programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In the hope of avoiding a fuss, Clegg plans a quiet birthday lunch at a nice hotel - but his pals are sure to throw a few spanners in the works. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: After seeing a man skiing on a van roof, the pals are intrigued to discover it is Gavin Hinchcliffe, an old friend renowned for his eccentricity. Comedy series, guest starring Bernard Cribbins, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Josephine Tewson

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Angela and Tony Forshaw want to sue for damages when their daughter Laura is refused a place at Cambridge. Peter discovers why Gloria and her son Scott are acting strangely, and Snell takes on the gas company when they threaten to build on sheep-grazing land. Meanwhile, more information comes to light about Simon's lifestyle

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: Jane and Davey investigate when the patriarch of a local aristocratic family is found stabbed to death, but find themselves revisiting an embarrassing chapter of their teenage romance. Crime drama, Starring Claire Goose

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The arrest of a Turkish girl who has been working illegally leads Ucos to reopen the case of Richard Gibson, a pub landlord who died in a fire in 2009. The original investigation concluded Gibson's death was probably suicide due to his dire financial situation, but the detectives have some questions about the pub's live-in barmaid, who disappeared on the night of the blaze. Could widowed landlady Joanne, pub regular Jason, or the dead man's best friend David, who happens to have a sideline in passing off his British-produced sparkling wine as French champagne, supply them with any answers? While the case tests the team's brain power, Sasha is also keen to raise their fitness levels as she signs them up for a five-a-side football competition. Phil Davis, Niamh Cusack and Tom Georgeson guest star

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is asked to help the police investigate the case of two brothers found dead in a police cell - but subsequent developments force her to confront the unpalatable truth about her involvement in a murder inquiry 13 years previously

programme.title: Gentleman Jack
programme.desc: Anne begins a playful but dangerous courtship with shy local heiress Miss Walker, while continuing her efforts to renovate Shibden Hall. However, when Miss Walker confides in her cousin, she is shocked by her reaction and discovers that Anne is not universally liked. The coal mining enterprise brings Anne into conflict with a local magistrate and his brother, and she hatches a plan to turn their underhanded business tactics against them. When a solution to a problem is uncovered, she is driven to confront her own past

programme.desc: As Barry tires of golf and looks for a new hobby, Billy's latest idea of an archery course is right on target. Long-running comedy series, starring Mike Grady, Keith Clifford and Peter Sallis

programme.desc: When an amnesiac wanders into their lives, Frank Hathaway and Luella Shakespeare must work out what happened to him. Comedy drama, starring Mark Benton and Jo Joyner

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank and Lu investigate a death threat at Runningbrook, an exclusive tennis club that hides a toxic threat. Crime drama, starring Mark Benton and Jo Joyner

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Steve McAndrew brings his dying father to London so he can spend his final days in a nearby hospice, but how much time he can spend with his parent is anyone's guess - the Ucos team is hard at work investigating the cold case murder of 55-year-old interpreter Agnes Bradley. A DNA sample provides a link to a rebellious teenager, and the team wonders if the killer could be related to him. But a whole new can of worms is opened when investigators discover the lad's mother was raped - could the same person have killed Agnes? Gerry and Steve hope that interviewing her friends from a local chess club may shed new light on the matter, but it's a possible professional issue that could hold the key to unlocking the mystery. Denis Lawson and Dennis Waterman star

programme.desc: Sam is not convinced a sports agent committed suicide, after a post-mortem reveals she was in the early stages of pregnancy and bruising to her arms suggests a sexual assault. programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: An elderly amateur sleuth who was a friend of Danny's is murdered, and he ends up embroiled in the case when his photo is found at the scene. However, the cold case copper becomes convinced that the secret to uncovering her real killer lies within the last case she was working on. Picking up where she left off, he travels to the village of Minchampton, where a woman was said to have been murdered by a local lad 25 years previously. Meanwhile, Sasha is left to cope with the investigating officer on the modern-day Miss Marple's murder - an overbearing contemporary from her Hendon training, by the name of DCI Grace Mackie - and Steve lets Gerry stay with him when he is evicted, but soon comes to regret the act of kindness

There's a cast iron mangle for woodworker Bruce Faulseit and upholsterer Leigh-Anne Treadwell sets to work trying to give a much-cherished chair a second chance. Sarah herself has a metal bed frame to repurpose

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in the Welsh county of Powys with a couple whose wish list includes an annexe for their parents, along with at least half an acre of land for their budget of £650,000. Jules also meets a man who scours space with his telescopes, looking for large, undiscovered objects that could be on a collision course with Earth

programme.desc: Suki sets her plan to take down Nish into action and Linda is determined to find some dirt on George. Sharon worries about Keanu's business skills so she hires Reiss to take care of the Arches accounts. Ben and Jay finally get Lexi to open up

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team welcome the Poet Laureate Simon Armitage into the Repair Shop who brings with him a harmonium, the subject of one of his poems that brings back memories of his late father. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. Finally, Kirsty visits jeweller Richard Talman, hoping he can fix her mum's silver charm bracelet gifted to her mother by her father in the early 1960s

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: The third kiss-off ends with a bang, as Dannii Minogue asks the couples to make their toughest choice yet - whether their relationships can survive outside the show. For one pairing, this represents a particular challenge, as they live a great distance from each other

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: The boys decide if they want to take their relationship into the real world - but not before one final party where everyone dresses up as their favourite queer icon. On the final day, family and friends come to visit, which leaves some of the boys with the unique experience of introducing them to a partner for the first time

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: How the lies of a factory worker claiming £90,000 for an accident at work were exposed when his bosses revealed he wasn't even on site. Plus, the driver who tried to get away with claiming for old damage to his car after a minor bump with a lorry is caught on camera and the cabbie who concocted a claim after a prang before being told to cough up thousands by a judge

programme.title: Fraud Squad
programme.desc: The trusted parish clerk who secretly transferred the entire council budget to himself. Plus, how hidden cameras, set up under cover of darkness, exposed a greedy council tenant's deceit. Presented by Michelle Ackerley

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is in Manchester to see a three-bed semi-detached house bought by a father and son property developing team. He's also in Sheffield viewing an interesting commercial unit that was previously a photography studio. Martel Maxwell is in Hartlepool to see a three-bed mid-terrace with a very low auction guide price

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Kate Bliss guide two teams in Narberth, west Wales, as they buy items to go head to head at auction in Cardiff. Host Christina Trevanion learns about a collection of First World War crested china, which was once overlooked by collectors

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Bear and Claudia's fun day splinters, while Kirsty discovers Nina's plans for VPAS. Rosie tries her hand at diagnosing patients, much to Al's chagrin

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: In Buckinghamshire, Sarah Moore sifts through boot-fulls of rubbish at Beaconsfield recycling centre in the hope of finding three gems amongst the junk. Lighting designer Duncan McKean takes on a pair of mirrors, while a lacrosse stick and a wrought iron stand test the creative mettle of blacksmiths Bex Simon and Dave Harris. Sarah herself sets to work updating a reproduction desk

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Two sisters combine their resources to find a secluded house in Somerset that has enough land to start their own music festival, but on a slightly smaller scale than the one the county is famous for. Alistair Appleton escorts is on hand to help and also takes time out to visit the village of Stoke St Gregory, where an old pub has been transformed into not just the local watering hole but a community shop and cafe too

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Donna and Dan's garden is small and messy with lots of sharp difficult surfaces that present a problem for their youngest daughter Emilia, who has Down's syndrome. Emilia and her sister Maya love nothing more than playing in the garden, but currently it's unsafe and needs to be redesigned with more forgiving materials so they don't hurt themselves. Donna was born and raised in Norway, so Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam set about building a sensory, Scandi-themed garden within a £3,000 budget for the family to enjoy

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to Bedford to meet single mum Katie. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, they transform her lacklustre bedroom into a relaxing space that doubles as a home office. Maxine Dwyer uses her potions to treat make-up spills on the carpet

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan joins Alexander Armstrong to co-host the quiz, in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the most obscure answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp presents the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Keanu continue to clash over the Arches and things get worse as Sonia and Reiss invite themselves over for the evening, forcing them to play host. Jay shares Lola's memory box with Kim and Billy and his friends realise just how much he is struggling with the grief

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Alastair and Anna live in Winchester, Hampshire, and badly need their sloped garden transformed into a curvaceous country cottage idyll. They want to grow vegetables as well as have an entertaining area - all a challenge with the different levels. Charlie Dimmock and Arit Anderson take up the challenge on a budget of £5,500

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Norfolk, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in King's Lynn to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A rota of BBC journalists, including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason, contribute to the weekly round-up from Westminster. Collectively, they deliver their usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip concerning the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: The heartless woman who put in multiple false claims to profit from tragedies such as the Grenfell Tower fire. Plus, the brazen conman who forgot which side of his body his fake injury was on

programme.title: Fraud Squad
programme.desc: Documentary following the investigators tracking down crooks who steal from the NHS. Officers catch a woman faking disability to claim half a million pounds in benefits

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A semi-detached house near Whitehaven in Cumbria and terraces in Norwich in Norfolk and Birmingham in the East Midlands are all bought at online auctions. Two are destined for the rental market, while the third is a couple's first family home for them and their baby daughter. Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow developments as their new owners realise their ambitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Ardingly in West Sussex as two pairs go in search of potentially profitable items at an antiques fair. Experts Jonathan Pratt and Ochuko Ojiri are on hand to help the red and blue teams. Eric also finds out all about the history of luxury Pullman railway carriages

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Mrs McCarthy gets an unwelcome birthday surprise when her life is threatened by a mysterious avenging angel. Crime drama, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Expert upcycler Jacqui Joseph is at Earlswood Recycling centre, scouring the skips for two items that she can rework to reveal their true potential. She enlists luggage legend Neil Wragg who has his hands full with some sofa leather, while Jacqui's creativity is tested with a mannequin

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Having spent 30 years living and working in Hong Kong, a would-be buyer teams up with presenter Jonnie Irwin, seeking a property in North Yorkshire on a budget of £350,000. Away from the property shopping, Jonnie heads to the Yorkshire Dales to discover what is being done to restore and preserve one of the most environmentally important landscapes in Europe

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull head to Runcorn, Cheshire, where they meet two Craigs. Each has different ideas about what they want from their bland back garden. One wants a stylish, contemporary space with clean lines and the other wishes to fill the garden with wildlife. Lee and Chris set about creating the perfect garden that pleases both on a £5,000 budget

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to Croydon, south London, to help new parents Adam and Jen with their unfinished nursery. After discovering they were expecting twins, DIY took a back seat, leaving the couple with no storage for their baby kit. The team has just 24 hours and a limited budget to make Adam and Jen's home child friendly

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Northern Ireland gymnast Rhys McClenaghan has won medals at all of the major international competitions. This documentary follows him as he takes part in 2022's three biggest events - the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham, the European Championships in Munich and the Gymnastics World Championships in Liverpool. In what was the toughest year of the 23-year-old's career so far, it offers an insight into his relentless training schedule and hears about the personal and physical sacrifices that come with being an elite athlete

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Olympic modern pentathlon gold medal winner Joe Choong, ex-England rugby League player Jon Wilkin, snowboarder Aimee Fuller and former world squash number one Nick Matthew join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rapper MIST, comedian Jayde Adams, interior designer Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and former Paralympian swimmer Ellie Simmonds join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Harry Hill hosts as comedian Jack Dee and journalist Zing Tsjeng join team captain Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the comedic side of recent headline stories

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: In a bid to acquire help Dom and Kay meet up with Kirsty, who divulges some classified information - if only to stop Dom shouting at her running club - but crucially tells them she cannot help. Back on the estate, the pair are forced to deal with the consequences of their drug-dealing activities - at which point Dom receives a call from Celia Herrington, offering them freedom from the gang in return for the dossier. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife duo Chris and Rosie are joined by star guests including Diversity's Jordan Banjo and Perri Kiely, who discuss their life-long friendship. Features include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: A new relationship threatens to upend the Chalmers-Davises, Jacinda navigates a complex friendship and Vince struggles to ask for what he needs. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Rosa's boys resist their new stepfather, while Oly and Santi find a new connection and Dom thinks about next steps. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: The Exorcist (1973)
programme.desc: A girl is possessed by a formidable demonic entity that resists all efforts at freeing her from its grasp. In desperation, the child's mother appeals for help from a local priest and a veteran exorcist, but succeeding in this nightmarish contest of wills threatens the lives of both men. William Friedkin's horror, starring Linda Blair, Jason Miller, Ellen Burstyn, Max von Sydow and Lee J Cobb

programme.desc: Lee and Chris head to Derby to help Bal and her family restore her late mum's garden to its former glory. With a budget of £6,500 the pair aim to make a colourful, Indian-inspired space where the family can gather and watch Bollywood movies on their outdoor cinema screen

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team help an avid recycler whose small flat is bursting at the seams. With a limited budget and 24 hours, they transform the overflowing spare room into a dining area

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: An elderly woman wakes up to find a burglar right by her bed, a family run pub discovers its new manager has a sinister secret, and a delivery driver angers the public by apparently stealing a child's ball. Presented by Dominic Littlewood

programme.desc: The duo bike through the Netherlands, Belgium and Luxembourg, where dishes include Dutch apple pie, Jewish buns, chocolate truffle cheesecake and macaroons with ice-cream

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: A man shares his passion for allotment gardening, Paul Rose gets on his bike with a group of cyclists, and Chris Packham and Megan McCubbin visit a colony of puffins

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: Scientists, climbers and wildlife film-makers explore the rainforests of Guyana, a former British colony in South America. Cameraman Gordon Buchanan finds giant otters almost as large as he is, canopy expert Justine Evans observes a family of red howler monkeys, and biologist Steve Backshall probes a habitat below a massive waterfall where frogs and freshwater crabs happily co-exist

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: I'm a Celebrity comrades Stanley Johnson and Georgia 'Toff' Toffolo compete to find profit-making antiques in Cumbria, guided by auctioneers Paul Laidlaw and Izzie Balmer. Toff takes time out from shopping to learn about the importance boats have played in the Lake District and Stanley learns about the conversation work of artist John Ruskin

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and David Harper hunt for antiques in the Bowes Museum at Barnard Castle in Co Durham. The venue was purpose-built to house the collection of Josephine and John Bowes. Presented by Paul Martin

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nina Conti, Nick Helm, Athena Kugblenu and Toby Tarrant test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in Bangor, County Down, en route to the Northern Irish capital of Belfast. Along the way he enjoys live music on a boat, stops off at the imposing parliament building at Stormont and explores the regenerated Titanic Quarter on the Maritime Mile

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: In Northern Ireland, the graveyard of a Victorian workhouse sheds light on one of the most traumatic periods of modern Irish history, the Great Famine of 1845. A team from Sheffield University want to understand the lives of people who occupied a village near the famous caves at Cresswell Crags in Nottinghamshire, and near Lincoln, a revisit to an Anglo Saxon site near proves rewarding

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan have their eyes set on the developing nests at RSPB Arne in Dorset, and Gillian Burke is moving down to the Llyn Peninsular in north Wales

programme.title: The Gallows Pole
programme.desc: David gathers his family and friends and explains he has brought some tools from Birmingham giving them the potential to transform everyone's lives. He then gives them a demonstration in the art of coin clipping, a method of forgery which uses slivers taken from one several real coins to make a counterfeit version. All they need now is to round up enough money to get them started. Shane Meadows drama, starring Michael Socha, Thomas Turgoose and Sophie McShera

programme.desc: The BBC's world affairs editor reflects on the week's major global news stories, talking to local experts from around the world to go behind the headlines

programme.title: The Edge (2019)
programme.desc: Documentary about England's Test cricket team between 2009 and 2013, the first and only English side to ever reach the top of the world rankings. Featuring contributions from Andrew Strauss, Kevin Pietersen, Alastair Cook, James Anderson, Stuart Broad, Monty Panesar, Graeme Swann, Jonathan Trott, Matt Prior, Ian Bell, Paul Collingwood, Steven Finn, Tim Bresnan, David Saker and Andy Flower

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: William Grint joins a group of deaf activists on an Extinction Rebellion demonstration in London. Julian Peedle-Calloo and Yvonne Cobb meet Kabir Kapoor, who has just become the first BSL Poet Laureate. And three deaf artists talk about their love of working with their hands

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Julia, Gloria and Angela hear from online shoppers who received the wrong order but were refused a refund and look at the importance of reading terms and conditions

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The five hopefuls are tasked to create a dish with ingredients that on paper shouldn't work, but that becomes an unlikely tasty treat. They then head off to the Francis Crick Institute in central London, Europe's largest biomedical laboratory, which aims to gain further understand into how living things work, and carries out ground-breaking research with the aim of helping to treat, diagnose and prevent human disease, where under the acclaimed chef Jozef Youssef, they cook a five-course celebratory lunch, recreating one of Josef's technically demanding recipes

programme.desc: The team head to Homerton, east London to help entrepreneurs Rob and Haley make the most out of their two-bed house that is overrun with pets

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace pays a visit to the Ambrosia factory in Lifton, Devon, to lift the lid on the 400g tin of rice pudding - one of the company's best sellers. He follows the process from the preparation of the rice and the blending of the milk to filling the cans, cooking and labelling - with up to 360,000 tins produced every day. Cherry Healey finds out about the millions of tons of rice grown in Italy's Po Valley every year and Ruth Goodman looks at the history of school dinners

programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers continue their journey in Germany, proving that German cuisine isn't all sausages and beer, but is based on regional specialities

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Arit Anderson visits a sustainable garden designed with nature and the environment in mind, Marcus Wareing gets tips from a specialist on how to grow shitake mushrooms and cameras catch up with George Lowther, who has created a lush tropical garden in Lincolnshire. Presented by Gethin Jones

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: The team travels deeper into the Guyanan jungle and scorpions and poisonous centipedes enter the base camp. Gordon Buchanan discovers an animal is stealing supplies and Steve Backshall finds giant piranha and long-fanged sabretooth fish in the river. Meanwhile, George McGavin catches an enormous tarantula and the climbing team tries to scale a huge unclimbed mountain at the forest's edge

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Comedian Bobby Davro and songstress Sheila Ferguson of the Three Degrees compete to find profit-making antiques in Kent, guided by experts James Braxton and Catherine Southon. Away from the contest, Bobby hears the little-known history of the Royal Engineers, while Sheila discovers how black culture and music arrived - and thrived - in the Garden of England

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Milestones Museum in Basingstoke, a place bursting with remnants from the town's industrial past. Elizabeth Talbot and James Lewis find the best antiques and collectibles to take to auction from the assembled crowd, while Paul visits the home of the man now considered to be the father of ecology, 18th-century naturalist Gilbert White

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nina Conti, Nick Helm, Athena Kugblenu and Toby Tarrant keep their eyes on the prize ahead of Friday's final, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his railway journey along the Atlantic and Irish Sea coasts of Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland. This time, he makes his way from the vast beaches of the Carlingford Peninsula towards Drogheda and Newgrange, before arriving in capital of the Republic of Ireland, Dublin, where he visits Dublin Castle and Dublin docks

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: How a lobster led archaeologists to the discovery of an 8,000-year-old Neolithic underwater settlement, and the team who excavated an Iron Age crouched burial at a secret location in Dorset. Also, Naoise Mac Sweeney visits a modern construction site as it gives up the secrets of an Elizabethan playhouse

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: As the team celebrates our seas, Gillian Burke ventures down the Llyn Peninsular and explores a seagrass meadow. Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan continue to explore the array of wildlife at RSPB Arne in Dorset

programme.title: Michael Tippett: The Shadow and the Light
programme.desc: The latest in John Bridcut's collection of award-winning films about British composers features the life and music of Michael Tippett, who died in 1998. For many years Tippett dominated the contemporary classical music scene in the UK. His life spanned almost the whole of the 20th century, and embraced many of the social issues of his time, from pacifism to homosexuality

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: A 12-year-old girl comes forward to say she has been groomed online and raped several times, so West Midlands Police quickly identify and arrest the suspect. However, as it is several weeks since the alleged attacks, there is limited physical evidence, so the officers have to rely on digital forensics, leaning heavily on two smartphones seized from the suspect

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: Advice for anyone considering dentistry abroad from specialist dentist Dr Rhona Eskander. Plus, an investigation into the pros and cons of medical technology

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan present from their new base at RSPB Arne in Dorset, where nest cameras are rigged and ready to capture all the drama of the season. Gillian Burke sets off to explore Snowdonia National Park

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan present further reports from RSPB Arne in Dorset, where Chris gets into the finer detail of some of the nests on site. Michaela heads out in search of all six of Britain's native reptile species, and Gillian Burke goes in search of Snowdonia's bats

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Imaginations run wild in this semi-final as the contestants' latest brief is to cook a dish both 'theatrical and fantastical' in nature. The hopefuls need to create a dish that pushes boundaries, playing with both mind and senses. Later, judges John Torode and Gregg Wallace have to determine who warrants contesting Finals Week

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Donna and Dan's garden is small and messy with lots of sharp difficult surfaces that present a problem for their youngest daughter Emilia, who has Down's syndrome. Emilia and her sister Maya love nothing more than playing in the garden, but currently it's unsafe and needs to be redesigned with more forgiving materials so they don't hurt themselves. Donna was born and raised in Norway, so Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam set about building a sensory, Scandi-themed garden within a £3,000 budget for the family to enjoy

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to Bedford to meet single mum Katie. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, they transform her lacklustre bedroom into a relaxing space that doubles as a home office. Maxine Dwyer uses her potions to treat make-up spills on the carpet

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for late spring and summer, sowing poppies and planting cornflowers for colour and interest in the Paradise Garden. Toby Buckland revels in some fabulous spring planting on a visit to the magnificent, landscaped gardens of Melbourne Hall in Derbyshire. Rachel de Thame meets a passionate dahlia grower who was once a florist working at the White House for President Obama and the First Lady

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: Slovakia, Hungary and Romania mark the halfway point in Si King and Dave Myers' baking odyssey. They begin in a cafe in Bratislava, where they are served three cakes inspired by British TV cookery shows, then taste kremesh, the Hungarian version of vanilla slice. They also try a roadside snack of deep-fried pastry with sour cream and cheese, an Eastern European take on bread-and-butter pudding, and cheese and bacon savoury scones, before ending this leg of their journey with a family party thrown by Dave's Romanian wife Lil

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Frances Tophill visits an allotment grower on the Isle of Man who uses her plants to make natural skincare products, Iolo Williams goes in search of a pair of Hen Harriers in Snowdonia, and Tom Kerridge show us how to make his special version of Eton mess

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: Steve Backshall reaches the summit of a table-top mountain, after climbing a vertical cliff face nearly as high as the Empire State Building. Meanwhile, Dr George McGavin and Gordon Buchanan have to haul three boats and all their kit through the jungle after finding the rapids of the Rewa River impassable. At the end of the journey, George presents a report on the expedition to the President of Guyana, Bharrat Jagdeo

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Comedians Jamali Maddix and Bobby Mair compete in West Yorkshire, guided by experts Natasha Raskin Sharp and Angus Ashworth. Between browsing for bargains and battling for the best punchline, Angus and Bobby explore the fascinating history of the printed page around the city of Leeds, while Jamali and Natasha explore how the strange evolution of the optical toy led to the profusion of games and media encountered today. In spite of advice, one funnyman thinks a porcelain parrot will be profitable, while the other invests in a toy robot. The duo then take their purchases to auction in Bourne End, Buckinghamshire

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Caroline Hawley head to the National Maritime Museum in Falmouth, Cornwall, where they unearth items including an unusual tortoise and an electric guitar

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nina Conti, Nick Helm, Athena Kugblenu and Toby Tarrant hope they have what it takes to win the final challenges, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from the capital of the Republic of Ireland, Dublin, on the DART suburban railway to the harbour town of Dun Laoghaire. He joins the crew of the RV Malice to survey what lies beneath the waves in Dublin Bay. Back on dry land, the DART takes Michael to his next stop, Sandycove, where James Joyce, one of Ireland's greatest writers, found inspiration

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson visits the Norfolk village of Cley next the Sea and finds that due to Dutch settlers in the Elizabethan era, it's not as 'next the sea' as it once was. Ben talks to historian Onyeka Nubia, who reveals that the village was part of a cosmopolitan community that introduced Britain to the canary and even the beer we drink today

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Carole Baxter is in the 8x6 greenhouse assessing progress so far and Scott Smith replaces the ornamental arch in the picket garden with a yew tree alternative. Lizzie Schofield continues her series in which she helps a couple turn the patch of turf outside their new build into a terrific outdoor space, and Brian Cunningham has the latest from his own garden in Old Scone

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Featuring Ramona Jones, who was diagnosed with autism in her twenties and discovered how she can find her true identity when she is in the garden. Monty Don makes some changes to pots in the Jewel Garden, and also plants out squash and harvests gooseberries. Adam Frost visits an Arts and Crafts garden in North Yorkshire, and finds much to inspire and surprise. And Rekha Mistry reveals her new garden in the Peak District

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: Cameras follow teams at three of the Trust's houses in Kent, including the former family home of Winston Churchill. Looking for a rural retreat within commutable distance of Westminster, in 1922 Winston and Clementine Churchill bought Chartwell House. The house was opened to the public in 1966, shortly after Churchill's death, and today it preserves a unique record of both his public and private lives

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Paul and Bob venture from London Euston to the Scottish Highlands, taking a sleeper train overnight to their destination. They wake in the stunning vista of the North West Scotland, where the pine forests and snow topped mountains almost take their breath away

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Faisal Islam

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Roads Not Taken (2020)
programme.desc: Drama following a day in the life of Leo and his daughter Molly, as he floats through alternate lives he could have lived, leading Molly to wrestle with her own path as she considers her future. Directed by Sally Potter and starring Javier Bardem and Elle Fanning

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: In-depth current affairs report covering a story behind the headlines

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: A look at the growth of paramilitary organisations in the early 1970s, with killings, explosions, intimidation and street disorder becoming widespread - with devastating and often lasting effects. Coercive control, intimidation, beatings and executions were part of how these groups operated in their different communities, a world in which people could be 'disappeared'', never to be found for decades afterwards

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: West Midlands Police work to identify who is responsible for a major fire that has burned a factory in Birmingham to the ground. Fire investigator Luke Beckett is deployed to open the case before vital evidence is destroyed by the blaze, but after searching the wreckage, the cause is still a mystery. With no natural sources of ignition, Luke concludes the fire was started deliberately and, in a stroke of luck, the factory's CCTV room is left intact after the fire

programme.title: Strike: Inside the Unions
programme.desc: Part two of two. Charting the start of the historic wave of 2022 strikes, which saw more days lost to strike action since the Thatcher era. Mick Lynch and the RMT are at the forefront of the movement alongside nurses withdrawing their labour for the first time in the union's 106-year history

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc: Paul Rose explores the spectacular coastline of southern Cornwall, discovering one of the world's finest stages at the Minack open-air theatre in Porthcurno. He also tries out the high-octane sport of coasteering on the Lizard Peninsula, joins a National Trust ranger for some clifftop wildlife spotting, and fires the Tudor cannons of Pendennis Castle in Falmouth

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc: An exploration of the textile mills and factories that once thrived in Britain during the Industrial Revolution. From New Lanark in Scotland to the mill town of Burnley, Fred meets ex-workers to discover what life was really like, and chats to a group that has dedicated 30 years to restoring mill engines

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.desc: The presenter tells the story of the 17th-century residence in Derbyshire - the pleasure palace of playboy Cavalier and ambitious courtier William Cavendish. Through a collection of artworks and items held within the castle, Lucy uncovers a colourful tale, capturing the tensions of England in the 1600s that would eventually lead the nation to civil war

programme.title: Lucy Worsley's Fireworks for a Tudor Queen
programme.desc: The historian teams up with materials scientist Zoe Laughlin in an ambitious attempt to recreate one of the earliest and most spectacular firework displays in Britain. The extravagant festivities were originally laid on by Robert Dudley, a close friend of Queen Elizabeth I, as an attempt win the Virgin Queen's hand in marriage in 1575, and Lucy travels to Italy for clues on how to make the Tudor equivalent of a Catherine Wheel

programme.title: Kisses at Fifty
programme.desc: Bill Maynard stars in Colin Welland's 1973 play about a married factory worker who kisses a barmaid in front of the whole pub on his 50th birthday - and the consequences for all around him. Directed by Michael Apted and co-starring Rosemarie Dunham, Marjorie Yates and Lori Wells

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: Rachel finally comes face to face with Shaun, who offers up the location of the CIA safe house before managing to evade arrest once more. The fugitive soldier flees into an encounter with two mysterious strangers, who offer to provide him with the answers he is looking for. Rachel pays Napier a visit, and the meeting leaves her more convinced than ever that the CCTV network has been compromised

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: The truth behind what happened to Shaun is revealed to him as he finally comes face to face with the powers behind his downfall. Rachel seeks answers of her own after her suspicions that Shaun has been set up are confirmed by a vital piece of evidence. However, the truth they both uncover places their lives in great danger

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: The mysterious Jessica Mallory arrives in London as the most closely guarded secrets of the intelligence services face exposure. Rachel faces a terrible choice that will not only decide Shaun's fate but also have an impact on the nation's entire criminal justice system. Famke Janssen (X-Men) guest stars in the conclusion of the crime drama

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc: Paul Rose explores the spectacular coastline of southern Cornwall, discovering one of the world's finest stages at the Minack open-air theatre in Porthcurno. He also tries out the high-octane sport of coasteering on the Lizard Peninsula, joins a National Trust ranger for some clifftop wildlife spotting, and fires the Tudor cannons of Pendennis Castle in Falmouth

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc: An exploration of the textile mills and factories that once thrived in Britain during the Industrial Revolution. From New Lanark in Scotland to the mill town of Burnley, Fred meets ex-workers to discover what life was really like, and chats to a group that has dedicated 30 years to restoring mill engines

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc: Paul Rose continues his journey by exploring the soft and rolling coastline of south Devon, taking a snorkelling trip around Burgh Island and hitching a ride on the Dartmouth to Paignton steam train

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc: The former steeplejack examines the history of the iron and steel industries, beginning with a visit to Ironbridge Gorge in Shropshire. Fred moves on to the Black Country, where he learns how the anchor for the ill-fated Titanic was made, before getting the chance to drive the biggest steam-powered rolling mill engine he has ever seen

programme.title: A House Through Time
programme.desc: David Olusoga traces the lives of 10 Guinea Street's occupants through the Second World War to the present day, discovering stories of love, loss and renewal. In the run-up to the war, the house is occupied by the younger generation of the Wallingtons, the long-term owners of number 10, who move back to the house after several years living in the rural Somerset. The Wallingtons are letting rooms to lodgers when war is declared in 1939, and would have sheltered in their cellar as German bombs rained down on Bristol. Over the 10 months of the Bristol Blitz, the ancient city is devastated and 3,000 houses destroyed. Number 10 itself is almost among them, as a bomb falls directly on Guinea Street, only missing the house by a whisker

programme.title: The Eiger Sanction (1975)
programme.desc: An art professor who once worked as an assassin is blackmailed into returning to his old career to eliminate a spy. However, his target is in the middle of a mountaineering expedition, forcing the hitman to embark on a perilous climb up the Eiger in hot pursuit. Action adventure, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With George Kennedy, Jack Cassidy and Vonetta McGee

programme.title: Hell or High Water (2016)
programme.desc: Divorcee Toby Howard and his ex-con older brother Tanner embark on a meticulously planned crime spree, hoping to rob every branch of the West Texas bank that has threatened to foreclose on their family ranch. However, they soon find themselves being pursued by two veteran Texas Rangers. Neo-Western drama, starring Jeff Bridges, Chris Pine and Ben Foster

programme.title: Lucy Worsley's Fireworks for a Tudor Queen
programme.desc: The historian teams up with materials scientist Zoe Laughlin in an ambitious attempt to recreate one of the earliest and most spectacular firework displays in Britain. The extravagant festivities were originally laid on by Robert Dudley, a close friend of Queen Elizabeth I, as an attempt win the Virgin Queen's hand in marriage in 1575, and Lucy travels to Italy for clues on how to make the Tudor equivalent of a Catherine Wheel

programme.title: Top of the Pops

programme.desc: Noel Edmonds presents an edition from June 8, 1978. With music by Manfred Mann's Earth Band, Lindisfarne, the Rolling Stones, Goldie, AC/DC, Boney M, Guy Marks, Maxine Nightingale and David Soul

programme.title: Queens of Soul
programme.desc: A compilation of archive footage to celebrate the critically-acclaimed female singers whose voices have come to define the soul genre, including Aretha Franklin, Roberta Flack, Gladys Knight, Randy Crawford, Angie Stone, Mary J Blige and Beyonce

programme.title: Killing Me Softly: The Roberta Flack Story
programme.desc: A documentary profile of the American singer, best known for her early 1970s hits such as The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face, Where Is the Love and Killing Me Softly with His Song. The programme documents her middle class upbringing, born out of the self-contained hub of a segregated country, and her relative late breakthrough, occurring in her mid thirties. As a solo and duet artist she had her detractors for adapting her style to white traditions, but eventually won over a nation with her soft, gentle tones. Contributors include Dionne Warwick, Johnny Mathis and Cissy Houston, as well as several reflections from Flack herself

programme.title: Aretha Franklin: Duets
programme.desc: Admirers including Elton John, Gloria Estefan, Smokey Robinson, PM Dawn, Bonnie Raitt and Rod Stewart share a stage with the Queen of Soul. The concert took place at Manhattan's Nederlander Theatre in 1993, as an AIDS benefit. Elton, Smokey and Rod provide backing vocals on the first number Chain of Fools

programme.title: BBC Proms
programme.desc: In a concert from last year's BBC Proms, Jules Buckley and his ensemble are joined by American singer and Quincy Jones protégée Sheléa to showcase the songs made famous by the Queen of Soul. Presented by Clara Amfo from the Royal Albert Hall

programme.title: The Baby Club
programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome babies Reau, Alfie, Charlie, Ollie, Otis, River and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Inside Giovanna’s bag is a night light, and all the parents and babies have different objects and toys that could be used as part of a bedtime routine. These are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding safe, baby-appropriate bedtime objects and toys inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The baby lullaby Little One Time For Bed features, as does a story involving Baby Bear, and viewers at home show what they’ve been doing at bedtime too. The Baby Bear Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory lights and the Goodbye Song.

In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp presents the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Keanu continue to clash over the Arches and things get worse as Sonia and Reiss invite themselves over for the evening, forcing them to play host. Jay shares Lola's memory box with Kim and Billy and his friends realise just how much he is struggling with the grief

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: A poignant and comical portrait of staff and players frequenting Judges Bingo hall in Tonypandy, where each week hundreds of locals gather with their dabbers ready in the hope of landing themselves the jackpot. In the house on this occasion are local tattoo shop owners AJ and his daughter Tammy, who discovers she's got something in common with bingo team member, Alix. In-between games, bingo regular 79-year-old grandmother Sylvia has a lesson in love for her grandson Ross and also sharing some quality-time are hospital carers, mother and daughter, Steph and Carrie. They're hoping that Cupid as well as Lady Luck will strike

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Norfolk, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in King's Lynn to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A rota of BBC journalists, including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason, contribute to the weekly round-up from Westminster. Collectively, they deliver their usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip concerning the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: The heartless woman who put in multiple false claims to profit from tragedies such as the Grenfell Tower fire. Plus, the brazen conman who forgot which side of his body his fake injury was on

programme.title: Fraud Squad
programme.desc: Documentary following the investigators tracking down crooks who steal from the NHS. Officers catch a woman faking disability to claim half a million pounds in benefits

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A semi-detached house near Whitehaven in Cumbria and terraces in Norwich in Norfolk and Birmingham in the East Midlands are all bought at online auctions. Two are destined for the rental market, while the third is a couple's first family home for them and their baby daughter. Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow developments as their new owners realise their ambitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Ardingly in West Sussex as two pairs go in search of potentially profitable items at an antiques fair. Experts Jonathan Pratt and Ochuko Ojiri are on hand to help the red and blue teams. Eric also finds out all about the history of luxury Pullman railway carriages

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Mrs McCarthy gets an unwelcome birthday surprise when her life is threatened by a mysterious avenging angel. Crime drama, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Expert upcycler Jacqui Joseph is at Earlswood Recycling centre, scouring the skips for two items that she can rework to reveal their true potential. She enlists luggage legend Neil Wragg who has his hands full with some sofa leather, while Jacqui's creativity is tested with a mannequin

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Having spent 30 years living and working in Hong Kong, a would-be buyer teams up with presenter Jonnie Irwin, seeking a property in North Yorkshire on a budget of £350,000. Away from the property shopping, Jonnie heads to the Yorkshire Dales to discover what is being done to restore and preserve one of the most environmentally important landscapes in Europe

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull head to Runcorn, Cheshire, where they meet two Craigs. Each has different ideas about what they want from their bland back garden. One wants a stylish, contemporary space with clean lines and the other wishes to fill the garden with wildlife. Lee and Chris set about creating the perfect garden that pleases both on a £5,000 budget

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to Croydon, south London, to help new parents Adam and Jen with their unfinished nursery. After discovering they were expecting twins, DIY took a back seat, leaving the couple with no storage for their baby kit. The team has just 24 hours and a limited budget to make Adam and Jen's home child friendly

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: The celebrated tenor and broadcaster mines BBC Wales's archives of 1975 to present some of that year's TV gold. Clips feature a communal loo in Newtown, a man on a bed of nails and a horse whisperer, Carmarthen's coracle fishermen, Welsh cakes and a harp-making community. Plus, well-known south Wales band Sassafras and a comedy flashback from The Goodies

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: Olympic modern pentathlon gold medal winner Joe Choong, ex-England rugby League player Jon Wilkin, snowboarder Aimee Fuller and former world squash number one Nick Matthew join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Northern Ireland gymnast Rhys McClenaghan has won medals at all of the major international competitions. This documentary follows him as he takes part in 2022's three biggest events - the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham, the European Championships in Munich and the Gymnastics World Championships in Liverpool. In what was the toughest year of the 23-year-old's career so far, it offers an insight into his relentless training schedule and hears about the personal and physical sacrifices that come with being an elite athlete

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Harry Hill hosts as comedian Jack Dee and journalist Zing Tsjeng join team captain Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the comedic side of recent headline stories

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: In a bid to acquire help Dom and Kay meet up with Kirsty, who divulges some classified information - if only to stop Dom shouting at her running club - but crucially tells them she cannot help. Back on the estate, the pair are forced to deal with the consequences of their drug-dealing activities - at which point Dom receives a call from Celia Herrington, offering them freedom from the gang in return for the dossier. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife duo Chris and Rosie are joined by star guests including Diversity's Jordan Banjo and Perri Kiely, who discuss their life-long friendship. Features include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: A new relationship threatens to upend the Chalmers-Davises, Jacinda navigates a complex friendship and Vince struggles to ask for what he needs. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Rosa's boys resist their new stepfather, while Oly and Santi find a new connection and Dom thinks about next steps. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: The Exorcist (1973)
programme.desc: A girl is possessed by a formidable demonic entity that resists all efforts at freeing her from its grasp. In desperation, the child's mother appeals for help from a local priest and a veteran exorcist, but succeeding in this nightmarish contest of wills threatens the lives of both men. William Friedkin's horror, starring Linda Blair, Jason Miller, Ellen Burstyn, Max von Sydow and Lee J Cobb

programme.title: Garden Rescue

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones presents the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Suki sets her plan to take down Nish into action and Linda is determined to find some dirt on George. Sharon worries about Keanu's business skills so she hires Reiss to take care of the Arches accounts. Ben and Jay finally get Lexi to open up

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team welcome the Poet Laureate Simon Armitage into the Repair Shop who brings with him a harmonium, the subject of one of his poems that brings back memories of his late father. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. Finally, Kirsty visits jeweller Richard Talman, hoping he can fix her mum's silver charm bracelet gifted to her mother by her father in the early 1960s

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: The third kiss-off ends with a bang, as Dannii Minogue asks the couples to make their toughest choice yet - whether their relationships can survive outside the show. For one pairing, this represents a particular challenge, as they live a great distance from each other

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: The boys decide if they want to take their relationship into the real world - but not before one final party where everyone dresses up as their favourite queer icon. On the final day, family and friends come to visit, which leaves some of the boys with the unique experience of introducing them to a partner for the first time

programme.title: The Edit
programme.desc: Entertainment news and chat with Amy Irons and David Farrell

programme.title: Debate Night
programme.desc: Topical debate on the big issues affecting Scotland and beyond. Members of the public have an hour to put their questions to a panel of politicians and other public figures about the biggest stories and the things they care about the most

programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: How the lies of a factory worker claiming £90,000 for an accident at work were exposed when his bosses revealed he wasn't even on site. Plus, the driver who tried to get away with claiming for old damage to his car after a minor bump with a lorry is caught on camera and the cabbie who concocted a claim after a prang before being told to cough up thousands by a judge

programme.title: Fraud Squad
programme.desc: The trusted parish clerk who secretly transferred the entire council budget to himself. Plus, how hidden cameras, set up under cover of darkness, exposed a greedy council tenant's deceit. Presented by Michelle Ackerley

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Kate Bliss guide two teams in Narberth, west Wales, as they buy items to go head to head at auction in Cardiff. Host Christina Trevanion learns about a collection of First World War crested china, which was once overlooked by collectors

programme.title: Scottish First Minister's Questions
programme.desc: Live coverage of questions in the Scottish Parliament to First Minister Humza Yousaf

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Bear and Claudia's fun day splinters, while Kirsty discovers Nina's plans for VPAS. Rosie tries her hand at diagnosing patients, much to Al's chagrin

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: In Buckinghamshire, Sarah Moore sifts through boot-fulls of rubbish at Beaconsfield recycling centre in the hope of finding three gems amongst the junk. Lighting designer Duncan McKean takes on a pair of mirrors, while a lacrosse stick and a wrought iron stand test the creative mettle of blacksmiths Bex Simon and Dave Harris. Sarah herself sets to work updating a reproduction desk

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Two sisters combine their resources to find a secluded house in Somerset that has enough land to start their own music festival, but on a slightly smaller scale than the one the county is famous for. Alistair Appleton escorts is on hand to help and also takes time out to visit the village of Stoke St Gregory, where an old pub has been transformed into not just the local watering hole but a community shop and cafe too

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Donna and Dan's garden is small and messy with lots of sharp difficult surfaces that present a problem for their youngest daughter Emilia, who has Down's syndrome. Emilia and her sister Maya love nothing more than playing in the garden, but currently it's unsafe and needs to be redesigned with more forgiving materials so they don't hurt themselves. Donna was born and raised in Norway, so Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam set about building a sensory, Scandi-themed garden within a £3,000 budget for the family to enjoy

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to Bedford to meet single mum Katie. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, they transform her lacklustre bedroom into a relaxing space that doubles as a home office. Maxine Dwyer uses her potions to treat make-up spills on the carpet

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan joins Alexander Armstrong to co-host the quiz, in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the most obscure answers

programme.desc: A moralistic Maggie rejects Nicole's offer to help with mClean & Tidy recruitment, but is left with food for thought after a heart to heart with Sonny.
