programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones presents the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Suki sets her plan to take down Nish into action and Linda is determined to find some dirt on George. Sharon worries about Keanu's business skills so she hires Reiss to take care of the Arches accounts. Ben and Jay finally get Lexi to open up

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team welcome the Poet Laureate Simon Armitage into the Repair Shop who brings with him a harmonium, the subject of one of his poems that brings back memories of his late father. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. Finally, Kirsty visits jeweller Richard Talman, hoping he can fix her mum's silver charm bracelet gifted to her mother by her father in the early 1960s

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Nolan Live
programme.desc: Stephen Nolan probes the issues that matter to the people of Northern Ireland, focusing on the stories of the week and the people making the headlines in lively debates, with viewers sending in their questions via text, email and tweet

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: The third kiss-off ends with a bang, as Dannii Minogue asks the couples to make their toughest choice yet - whether their relationships can survive outside the show. For one pairing, this represents a particular challenge, as they live a great distance from each other

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: The boys decide if they want to take their relationship into the real world - but not before one final party where everyone dresses up as their favourite queer icon. On the final day, family and friends come to visit, which leaves some of the boys with the unique experience of introducing them to a partner for the first time

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: How the lies of a factory worker claiming £90,000 for an accident at work were exposed when his bosses revealed he wasn't even on site. Plus, the driver who tried to get away with claiming for old damage to his car after a minor bump with a lorry is caught on camera and the cabbie who concocted a claim after a prang before being told to cough up thousands by a judge

programme.title: Fraud Squad
programme.desc: The trusted parish clerk who secretly transferred the entire council budget to himself. Plus, how hidden cameras, set up under cover of darkness, exposed a greedy council tenant's deceit. Presented by Michelle Ackerley

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is in Manchester to see a three-bed semi-detached house bought by a father and son property developing team. He's also in Sheffield viewing an interesting commercial unit that was previously a photography studio. Martel Maxwell is in Hartlepool to see a three-bed mid-terrace with a very low auction guide price

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Kate Bliss guide two teams in Narberth, west Wales, as they buy items to go head to head at auction in Cardiff. Host Christina Trevanion learns about a collection of First World War crested china, which was once overlooked by collectors

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Bear and Claudia's fun day splinters, while Kirsty discovers Nina's plans for VPAS. Rosie tries her hand at diagnosing patients, much to Al's chagrin

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: In Buckinghamshire, Sarah Moore sifts through boot-fulls of rubbish at Beaconsfield recycling centre in the hope of finding three gems amongst the junk. Lighting designer Duncan McKean takes on a pair of mirrors, while a lacrosse stick and a wrought iron stand test the creative mettle of blacksmiths Bex Simon and Dave Harris. Sarah herself sets to work updating a reproduction desk

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Two sisters combine their resources to find a secluded house in Somerset that has enough land to start their own music festival, but on a slightly smaller scale than the one the county is famous for. Alistair Appleton escorts is on hand to help and also takes time out to visit the village of Stoke St Gregory, where an old pub has been transformed into not just the local watering hole but a community shop and cafe too

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Donna and Dan's garden is small and messy with lots of sharp difficult surfaces that present a problem for their youngest daughter Emilia, who has Down's syndrome. Emilia and her sister Maya love nothing more than playing in the garden, but currently it's unsafe and needs to be redesigned with more forgiving materials so they don't hurt themselves. Donna was born and raised in Norway, so Charlie Dimmock and Flo Headlam set about building a sensory, Scandi-themed garden within a £3,000 budget for the family to enjoy

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to Bedford to meet single mum Katie. In just 24 hours, on a limited budget, they transform her lacklustre bedroom into a relaxing space that doubles as a home office. Maxine Dwyer uses her potions to treat make-up spills on the carpet

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan joins Alexander Armstrong to co-host the quiz, in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the most obscure answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp presents the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Keanu continue to clash over the Arches and things get worse as Sonia and Reiss invite themselves over for the evening, forcing them to play host. Jay shares Lola's memory box with Kim and Billy and his friends realise just how much he is struggling with the grief

programme.title: A Wright Family Holiday
programme.desc: Reality TV star Mark Wright embarks on an epic road trip across Britain in the company of his brother Josh and father Big Mark. Along the way they open up about things that they've never spoken about before. For Mark it's a chance to reconnect focus on the things in life that really matter, Big Mark wants to regain his confidence after almost losing his life to Covid, while for Josh, it's a chance to experience things he was never able to do while he was a professional footballer. Among other things, they tackle a white-knuckle mountain bike ride, sleep in an abandoned slate mine and reflect on a tough few years

programme.title: Community Life
programme.desc: Barra Best reveals the sometimes surprising and always inspiring things going on in community groups. In Fermanagh, he joins a group of cavers as they retrieve litter from some of the county's underground caves. Plus, Connor Phillips goes on a mission to find out if new 'Chatty Benches' in east Belfast are helping to get people talking, Lynette Fay is bowled over when she meets the Cloughmills community leading the way in sustainability and Vinny Hurrell meets some of those working with Women's Aid Armagh and Down

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Having enjoyed researching the lives of her onscreen characters in The Crown, actress Claire Foy looks forward to delving into the lives of her own ancestors. After reminiscing about their Irish roots, her maternal grandfather directs her to 'The Castle' in Carlisle, the site of the military barracks where her great, great grandparents Henry and Maria Stimpson lived. Claire's father David was adopted, but was reunited with his birth mother Joyce later in life. Despite having got to know Joyce, he knows nothing of her ancestors, so Claire sets out to find out more

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers presents a review of the week's political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from Norfolk, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in King's Lynn to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A rota of BBC journalists, including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason, contribute to the weekly round-up from Westminster. Collectively, they deliver their usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip concerning the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: The heartless woman who put in multiple false claims to profit from tragedies such as the Grenfell Tower fire. Plus, the brazen conman who forgot which side of his body his fake injury was on

programme.title: Fraud Squad
programme.desc: Documentary following the investigators tracking down crooks who steal from the NHS. Officers catch a woman faking disability to claim half a million pounds in benefits

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A semi-detached house near Whitehaven in Cumbria and terraces in Norwich in Norfolk and Birmingham in the East Midlands are all bought at online auctions. Two are destined for the rental market, while the third is a couple's first family home for them and their baby daughter. Martin Roberts, Dion Dublin and Martel Maxwell follow developments as their new owners realise their ambitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from Ardingly in West Sussex as two pairs go in search of potentially profitable items at an antiques fair. Experts Jonathan Pratt and Ochuko Ojiri are on hand to help the red and blue teams. Eric also finds out all about the history of luxury Pullman railway carriages

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Mrs McCarthy gets an unwelcome birthday surprise when her life is threatened by a mysterious avenging angel. Crime drama, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Expert upcycler Jacqui Joseph is at Earlswood Recycling centre, scouring the skips for two items that she can rework to reveal their true potential. She enlists luggage legend Neil Wragg who has his hands full with some sofa leather, while Jacqui's creativity is tested with a mannequin

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Having spent 30 years living and working in Hong Kong, a would-be buyer teams up with presenter Jonnie Irwin, seeking a property in North Yorkshire on a budget of £350,000. Away from the property shopping, Jonnie heads to the Yorkshire Dales to discover what is being done to restore and preserve one of the most environmentally important landscapes in Europe

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee Burkhill and Chris Hull head to Runcorn, Cheshire, where they meet two Craigs. Each has different ideas about what they want from their bland back garden. One wants a stylish, contemporary space with clean lines and the other wishes to fill the garden with wildlife. Lee and Chris set about creating the perfect garden that pleases both on a £5,000 budget

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team heads to Croydon, south London, to help new parents Adam and Jen with their unfinished nursery. After discovering they were expecting twins, DIY took a back seat, leaving the couple with no storage for their baby kit. The team has just 24 hours and a limited budget to make Adam and Jen's home child friendly

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp round off the working week with a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: Feed Yourself Fitter with Stephen Nolan
programme.desc: Cold water swimmer Mary has no problem braving the icy waters of Lough Neagh every Sunday. How she looks doesn't bother her in the slightest, but what her extra weight is doing to her health very much does. Having piled on the pounds year on year for over two decades she is suffering more and more from increasing aches and pains. Mary is the heaviest she has ever been and she knows it's not good for her. Sympathetic to her plight, Stephen joins her in the kitchen as she samples healthy foods including scallops for the first time, courtesy of chef Michael Deane

programme.title: Restoration Rescue
programme.desc: Patrick Bradley meets a couple from the seaside village of Donaghadee who plan on transforming a disused High Street bank dating back 100 years into a modern home. Spanning three floors, the renovation will be no easy task and neither will deciding what to do with the original walk in safe. Patrick investigates the history of the building and researches the evolution of banking over the last 100 years

programme.title: Our Lives
programme.desc: Northern Ireland gymnast Rhys McClenaghan has won medals at all of the major international competitions. This documentary follows him as he takes part in 2022's three biggest events - the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham, the European Championships in Munich and the Gymnastics World Championships in Liverpool. In what was the toughest year of the 23-year-old's career so far, it offers an insight into his relentless training schedule and hears about the personal and physical sacrifices that come with being an elite athlete

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Harry Hill hosts as comedian Jack Dee and journalist Zing Tsjeng join team captain Paul Merton and Ian Hislop to delve into the comedic side of recent headline stories

programme.title: Black Ops
programme.desc: In a bid to acquire help Dom and Kay meet up with Kirsty, who divulges some classified information - if only to stop Dom shouting at her running club - but crucially tells them she cannot help. Back on the estate, the pair are forced to deal with the consequences of their drug-dealing activities - at which point Dom receives a call from Celia Herrington, offering them freedom from the gang in return for the dossier. Comedy thriller, starring Gbemisola Ikumelo and Hammed Animashaun, with Zoe Wanamaker

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Chris & Rosie Ramsey Show
programme.desc: Husband-and-wife duo Chris and Rosie are joined by star guests including Diversity's Jordan Banjo and Perri Kiely, who discuss their life-long friendship. Features include Please Keep Me Anonymous, where a well-known face reads out some terrifying audience confessions and It Goes or I Go, where audience members compete to rid themselves of something their loved one refuses to remove from the house

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: A new relationship threatens to upend the Chalmers-Davises, Jacinda navigates a complex friendship and Vince struggles to ask for what he needs. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: Bump
programme.desc: Rosa's boys resist their new stepfather, while Oly and Santi find a new connection and Dom thinks about next steps. Australian drama, starring Nathalie Morris

programme.title: The Exorcist (1973)
programme.desc: A girl is possessed by a formidable demonic entity that resists all efforts at freeing her from its grasp. In desperation, the child's mother appeals for help from a local priest and a veteran exorcist, but succeeding in this nightmarish contest of wills threatens the lives of both men. William Friedkin's horror, starring Linda Blair, Jason Miller, Ellen Burstyn, Max von Sydow and Lee J Cobb

programme.title: Women in Charge: Is India Changing?
programme.desc: For so long, women in India have fought for equality at home and the right to be in charge of their families. Now as India marches on to be the world's most populous country, a mini revolution is taking place. Divya Arya meets some of the women, helped by migration and education, who have become the head of their families, and asks what impact it will have on the one point four billion people that now live in India?

programme.title: Our World
programme.desc: Russia is supplying the Myanmar military with advanced fighter jets and training their pilots how to use them in a war against their own people. More than two years on from the coup, the country's military is facing a countrywide armed uprising and their troops are struggling to hold ground and recruit foot soldiers. So, the strategy is turning increasingly to the air with devastating consequences. BBC's Asia editor Rebecca Henschke follows those fighting back on the ground and in the air. And she meets defectors from the air force who give exclusive insight into the strategy and psychology behind those operating these deadly machines.

programme.title: HARDtalk
programme.desc: Another chance to watch Zeinab Badawi’s 2014 interview with acclaimed Ghanaian writer Ama Ata Aidoo, who has died aged 81. A former education minister, she arguably did more than any other writer to depict and celebrate the condition of women in Africa and was opposed to what she described as a 'western perception that the African female is a downtrodden wretch'.

programme.desc: Since his diagnosis in 2019, rugby league star Rob Burrow has been battling Motor Neurone Disease, with wife Lindsey by his side. Last month she took part in the first Leeds marathon, one that saw memorable footage of Rob being carried over the finish line by his friend and former teammate Kevin Sinfield. Cameras follow Lindsey as she fits in marathon training with working and family life, while exploring the wider impact of this debilitating and terminal disease

Martin Clunes stars

programme.title: Vicky McClure: My Grandad's War
programme.desc: In this one-off special to mark the anniversary of D-Day, the actress embarks on an emotional journey with her 97-year-old grandfather, Ralph, to learn about his role in the most extraordinary single day of the Second World War. Vicky sets out to understand how Ralph - then still a teenager from Nottingham - found himself in the Royal Navy and at the centre of a world-changing battle on the Normandy beaches on June 6, 1944. The pair visit the only surviving example of the type of landing craft he trained and crossed the Channel on, and discover aerial pictures believed to show his flotilla landing at Normandy - before travelling back to the beach he last visited almost 80 years ago

Cameras follow Lindsey as she fits in marathon training with working and family life, while exploring the wider impact of this debilitating and terminal disease

Martin Clunes stars

programme.title: Vicky McClure: My Grandad's War
programme.desc: In this one-off special to mark the anniversary of D-Day, the actress embarks on an emotional journey with her 97-year-old grandfather, Ralph, to learn about his role in the most extraordinary single day of the Second World War. Vicky sets out to understand how Ralph - then still a teenager from Nottingham - found himself in the Royal Navy and at the centre of a world-changing battle on the Normandy beaches on June 6, 1944. The pair visit the only surviving example of the type of landing craft he trained and crossed the Channel on, and discover aerial pictures believed to show his flotilla landing at Normandy - before travelling back to the beach he last visited almost 80 years ago

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Rampage
programme.desc: Hard-hitting action from the world of All Elite Wrestling - the roster features world-class talent including Powerhouse Hobbs, Claudio Castagnoli, Ricky Starks and Jade Cargill, as well as many more athletes who bringing a freshness and energy into professional wrestling.

programme.title: World's Funniest Videos
programme.desc: Things seldom go the way we envision them - that’s why it’s good to be able to improvise. In fact, as we’ll see in this episode, our best laid plans can often lead to some unexpected and fun consequences - we’ve got the video proof in segments including What Were You Thinking?, Watch Your Step!, Your Own Worst Enemy and Collateral Damage. We’ll also feature the top ten times you didn't realise there was a glass door there... and the inevitable results.

programme.title: Totally Bonkers Guinness World Records

programme.title: Dawson's Creek
programme.desc: Abby starts to have a bad influence on Jen, and Andie's brother Jack lands a job at the Ice House. An entry in Joey's diary lands her in hot water with Dawson - who in turn forgets Pacey's 16th birthday. James Van Der Beek, Katie Holmes, Joshua Jackson and Michelle Williams star

programme.desc: Scarlett Moffatt hosts, as singleton Rashaun chooses to date one of Harley, Naomi and Keelie - not on their looks but their cooking skills. After picking his favourite menu, the cook behind it reveals themselves and joins him for a date

programme.title: Dress to Impress

programme.desc: Dating show in which a celebrity has three meals cooked for them by three unsuspecting blind dates. In the first episode, actor and TV presenter Joe Swash looks at five menus and chooses his three dates based on the ones he likes the look of most. His dates will not be expecting to open the door to a celebrity, but when the dinners have been eaten and the dates are done, who will he want to see for seconds?

programme.title: One Tree Hill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brooke faces an emotional reunion with her mother, Mouth makes a surprising announcement and the consequences of Dan's accident are revealed. programme.title: Dawson's Creek
programme.desc: A class assignment gives Jen the chance to win Dawson back and Pacey learns the truth about Andie's wealth. programme.title: World's Funniest Videos
programme.desc: Sure, there are going to be some obstacles in life, but join us as we present a healthy reminder that life goes on. How do we celebrate that point? With everyday people having a great time just being themselves - we see a boy get rolled over by a huge snowball, kids swinging like Tarzan, a man dressed as a mermaid and how life looks in slow motion. We’ll also see what happens to people who hysterically earn their way into our countdown The Top Ten Times You Should Have Quit While You're Ahead.

programme.desc: Vernon suffers delusions of grandeur while playing bodyguard to a Russian prince staying at Ashfordly Hall, leaving David to help Bellamy with preparations for a special VIP evening of his own. programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sergeant Craddock investigates a suspicious road accident, and has to suffer the embarrassment of interrogating the High Sheriff about his involvement in the incident. Meanwhile, Gina has shattering news for Phil Bellamy, and Vernon opens a marriage bureau, which proves to have unforeseen consequences - for David at least. Rural drama, guest starring Angela Douglas (Carry On Cowboy)

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Diane throws a surprise medieval birthday party for Jack, giving Katie and Robert the perfect excuse to be alone together. Later, Nicola apologises to Simon

Foyle is convinced there is another explanation, but his priorities shift when news of a missing boy from London reaches Hastings. Starring Michael Kitchen, Phyllida Law and Nicholas Woodeson

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy finds himself in over his head when he allows personal feelings to cloud his judgement in the case of a robbery suspect. Meanwhile, Vernon hopes great things will come of his newly installed party phone line. Rural drama, starring Mark Jordon and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An investigation into the appearance of forged bank notes in Aidensfield leads to the discovery of a major crime operation, and Blaketon is persuaded to try a new image by Vernon _ with unfortunate repercussions. Meanwhile, Mike's suggestion that he and Jackie start a family is not met with the expected response. Rural police drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A case from 13 years earlier returns to haunt Lewis when the evidence comes under review. Graham Lawrie was incarcerated in a secure psychiatric hospital after being found guilty of the murders of three police officers, but now the findings of the forensics lab have been called into question and an appeal has been launched. As Lawrie remains locked up ahead of his day in court, PC Mark Travis is lured to an isolated location with a hoax call and falls victim to a killer who uses the same weapon as that used in the original murders

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the murder of a wealthy man whose double life left him vulnerable to exploitation. programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Troubled saleswoman Helen (Nicola Walker), whose mother was murdered back in episode one, turns up on Janet's doorstep with information that takes the investigation in a completely different direction - paving the way for the formidable Det Supt Julie Dodson to be called in. Michael Kitchen, Anthony Howell and Honeysuckle Weeks star, with guest Jay Benedict

Rural police drama, starring Fiona Dolman and Jason Durr

programme.desc: Jackie is assigned to act for a businessman accused of raping a fellow hotel guest during a conference, but she is not sure whether to believe he is innocent or not. Meanwhile, Vernon and David are dismayed to find their finances have hit rock-bottom and find themselves forced to seek employment to pay their electricity bill. Rural drama, starring Fiona Dolman, David Lonsdale and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.desc: Respected surgeon Dan Marsden is shot dead days before his retirement and his teenage daughters Mira and Karen are abducted. Joined by a new addition to the ranks, Vera investigates a mysterious parcel and a connection to the Iraq War as she races against time to catch the killer and save the girls. However, the case soon takes a violent and unexpected turn, striking at the heart of the team. Guest starring Saskia Reeves (Luther) and Dean Andrews (Ashes to Ashes), with Brenda Blethyn, David Leon and Gareth Farr

programme.desc: Having realised her marriage is a mistake, Rachel is still staying at Janet's and making excuses for her absence, but Sean isn't prepared to accept that things have gone so wrong, so quickly. Detective drama, starring Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp and Sean Maguire

Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp, Suranne Jones and Danny Miller

programme.desc: Maria tells Toyah about her pregnancy, although neglects to mention it is the result of her fling with John, while Sunita and Ciaran get intimate and Peter hopes to take up where he left off with Lucy.

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: It is July 1945 and, as Britain settles into peacetime, Foyle looks forward to retirement, but finds his life in turmoil once more when Samantha's employer Sir Leonard Spencer-Jones is found dead. Suspicion falls on Niko, a Russian PoW, who flees the Sussex coast and heads for a sanctuary in London - closely followed by Foyle, who has been sent to track him down by the War Office. But the investigation soon brings to light a conspiracy and an international cover-up which, if exposed, could bring down the British government. Max Brown joins the cast, with Michael Kitchen, Honeysuckle Weeks, Anthony Howell, Eleanor Bron and Christopher Good

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The constabulary are on guard as the village is plagued by a series of mysterious explosions, while a redundant church provides Vernon and David with their next fortune-hunting endeavour. Nostalgic drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes and David Lonsdale

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A Russian chess champion arrives to compete in an exhibition match, causing a crisis for the constabulary, who also find themselves on the trail of an exceptionally devious burglar. Meanwhile, David and Vernon face problems a little closer to home. Rural police drama, starring David Lonsdale and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The GP is left holding the baby after upsetting the new childminder, but luckily Mike agrees to look after James at short notice. However, Louisa is not happy with the arrangement and an argument erupts between the newlyweds just as their guests, Dennis and Karen Dodds, arrive for dinner - and that's only the first of the evening's problems. Meanwhile, Ruth is roped into taking part in a phone-in programme on Radio Portwenn and unwittingly answers a call from PC Penhale, who wants to know how to make friends in the village

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: A secret admirer makes Ruth feel a little uncomfortable when he places a red rose on her car windscreen and then leaves a birthday cake on her kitchen table while she's at the radio station, and when matters take a turn for the worse, Martin has no choice but to take drastic action. Meanwhile, Bert is furious when one of Louisa's pupils writes a damning review of his restaurant in the school newspaper, and a new pharmacist arrives in the village. Annabelle Apsion (Shameless) joins the cast

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: With their friendship in tatters, the lack of communication between Rachel and Janet is making even the simplest of tasks difficult, and it takes a call about Gill's possible abduction to reunite them as a team. The duo soon have Gill's car in their sights and identify the kidnapper, but discover they are heading for a notorious suicide location. Can the detectives get to their boss in time?

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: A vulnerable young man is reported missing by his pub landlord boss. Syndicate 9 suspect Robin McKendrick may have been killed after a photo of him bound and gagged in a car boot appears online. However, the case takes an unusual turn when a body found in a flooded quarry turns out to be a woman's corpse. Meanwhile, battle-scarred from their conflict last year, Scott and Bailey are determined to move forward with honesty. The pair find themselves in front of the promotion board and pass with flying colours, leaving Gill with the task of choosing who stays on as sergeant at the department. Danny Webb joins a cast led by Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones

programme.desc: Terry protects a widowed garage owner from her grasping family and Arthur spots a chance to achieve one of his greatest ambitions - getting his hands on a Rolls-Royce. Lionel Jeffries and Keith Barron guest star alongside Dennis Waterman and George Cole

programme.desc: Mycroft Holmes joins his brother to investigate the murder of a professor's secretary. The only clue is a golden pince-nez found clenched in the hand of the victim. Charles Gray guest stars

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: The private eye's conscience is pricked by a fortune cookie prediction, so he decides to return a few of the favours he owes his friends - but his efforts soon lead to kidnapping and attempted murder. Detective drama, starring Tom Selleck

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Templar investigates allegations that the Loch Ness monster not only exists, but is also responsible for a mysterious spate of killings in Scotland. Fulton Mackay guest stars alongside Roger Moore

programme.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A reclusive lodger's strange behaviour sends his landlady running to Holmes for advice - and what initially seems to be a simple matter turns into a mystery involving an Italian secret society and murder in New York. Drama, starring Jeremy Brett

programme.title: Isle of Man TT
programme.desc: Action from the opening Superstock race, as the best road racers in the world battled for the fourth race win of the TT week

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: A pair of crooks hijack TC's helicopter and use it to free a convict who is determined to kill Thomas in revenge for putting him behind bars in the first place. Detective drama, starring Tom Selleck

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: When Scooby Doo and the gang are on the trail of a monstrous gargoyle in the nighttime city of Paris they're stumped and need help solving the mystery. Velma turns to a close friend that's in Paris for work. It's none other than famous fashion model Gigi Hadid! Velma and Gigi studied Criminal Psychology together and Velma was always impressed with how great Gigi is at picking up clues. Gigi happily joins our gang to get to the bottom of this mysterious gargoyle and what it's really after in the City of Lights. Clues lead to forged paintings and an art theft in the Louvre and the destruction of Paris Fashion Week by the gargoyle! Gigi must orchestrate getting our gang to strut their modeling stuff on the runway in order to save Fashion Week rescue priceless art solve the mystery and give the world its newest modeling sensation Scoobert Scooby Doo.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: When Shaggy and Scooby are excited to visit a scary haunted old castle in Germany the rest of the gang are confused until they meet up with none other than famous chef writer and TV presenter Alton Brown! Shaggy Scooby and Alton are good friends (mostly because they will happily eat any experimental scientific food experiment Alton comes up with). Alton Brown is on the trail of his ancestor mad scientist Dr. Cornelius Frankenfooder! It's said he made a crazy Monster from animated foodstuffs that haunts this old castle to this day. Mr. Brown has to get to the bottom of this familial mystery. Obviously our gang is on board to help. Come for the kooky scientific food creations. Stay for the horrible monster! It's definitely a mystery our gang can sink their teeth into…hopefully before the monster sinks its teeth into our gang!

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: When Scooby Doo and the gang are investigating a mysterious ghost at the Dergfall Boldman Department Store (a historic mecca of high fashion on 5th Avenue) they bump into none other than fashion icon Tim Gunn! When told of the demonic ghost of an old elevator operator terrorizing the famous store and its clientele Mr. Gunn insists on joining forces with our gang to solve this mystery that leads from the creepy old basement full of hundred-year-old mannequins to a lost floor hidden between two floors of the old building. Can our gang and Tim Gunn survive this crazy elevator ride from the netherworld? Can Mr. Gunn survive how crooked Fred's ascot always is? And more importantly can Tim Gunn solve the greatest mystery of all time: how to find the perfect new style for Shaggy?

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil catch up with Steph and Mark who, in 2011, asked for their help to find a property they could live together and eventually have children in. Phil helped them find a project property with three bedrooms for nearly £40,000 under their budget. Today, they are still in the property which looks now looks very different. In 2020, Kirstie and Phil met Elliot and James who were looking to find a home they could share with four bedrooms and an open plan entertaining space in London. After a struggle with the budget, Kirstie found the pair a property, now Phil is back to find out what they have done with the space

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi is joined by Eddie Izzard on an Irish adventure as they visit three holiday hideaways in Counties Clare, Kerry and Cork and bond over homemade apple crumble. Their first stop in County Clare is a miniature modern marvel called Teeroneer, a timber-clad, prize-winning property with a sunken kitchen that Sandi just can't resist cooking in. From there the pair head to Ark Ranch Treehouse. Hand-built by one woman, Sandi and Eddie are charmed by the sense of childhood adventure they feel. Finally, they head to Lost Cottage in the mountains and lakes of County Kerry. A classic fusion of old and new, the remote rental gives the pair an excuse for Sandi to take Eddie on her very first fishing trip

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: Dispatches follows four pensioners through winter as they struggle to make ends meet with the exceedingly high price of energy and soaring inflation. John, 76, lives alone in Sunderland in the home he used to share with his parents and siblings and spends his nights sat in darkness, afraid his energy bills are too high to turn the lights on. Sixty eight-year-old Doreen has had only two visitors in the 38 years she has lived in her home and goes to bed early to stay warm. In rural Leicestershire, 82-year-old Harry and his wife 77-year-old Christine skip dinner as a desperate attempt at cutting costs

programme.title: Married to a Psychopath
programme.desc: Part one of two. The story of the hunt for murderer Malcolm Webster, who targeted wealthy women for their money. The programme explores the crimes from the perspective of detective Charles Henry, who was behind the three-year investigation to re-open a cold case. He would later be joined by 20 colleagues, who gathered more than 1,000 witness statements and used 90 search warrants for banks, building societies and solicitors

programme.title: A Paedophile in My Family: Surviving Dad
programme.desc: Documentary following a successful businesswoman who carries the weight of a childhood of repeated sexual abuse by her father. With his release from prison, Emily considers confronting the person who dominated her childhood as she seeks to find out if the time inside has changed him at all. She reaches out to those from her formative years - teachers, family friends, and her mother, trying to understand how her abuse remained and reconnects with the police officers who dealt with her case, hidden for so long

programme.title: Nobody's Fool (2018)
programme.desc: The recently paroled Tanya suspects her high-flying sister Danica is in an online relationship with a man who may not be what he seems. Eventually Danica, her friend Kalli and Tanya attempt to get to the bottom of the mystery. Writer/director Tyler Perry's romantic comedy, starring Tiffany Haddish, Tika Sumpter and Whoopi Goldberg

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: In Oregon, Gordon Ramsay tries to rescue the Applegate River Lodge, which is around $1million in debt. The chef questions whether owner Richard Davis's interest in smoking cannabis is distracting him from the problems at this family-built inn, and encounters Richard's sons Duke and Dusty, whose fiery relationship seems to prevent them from working together to tackle the establishment's financial troubles

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Fame in the Family
programme.desc: Neil 'Razor' Ruddock hosts a dinner party for four people he has never met - one of whom is a distant relative of the former football star. The question is, which one?

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with three house-hunters with two very different needs, but one shared goal. In 2018, schoolteacher Katy, her comedian husband Charlie, baby daughter Lola, and pet pooch Harper were on the hunt for their first family home in Brighton. Having moved in with Katy's mum to save for a deposit, they had not only grown used to home comforts, but also the vibrant village atmosphere of pricey Fiveways - an area where their property dreams didn't match their budget. With Phil's help they widened the net, viewing four fantastic finds in and around Brighton. Two years later, Phil's back to see whether life on the coast has been plain sailing. And in 2019, Kirstie was scouring east London with 'granny on the go' Janet. Having been diagnosed with a degenerative back condition, Janet was desperate to ditch her lift-less, third storey flat in exchange for a ground-floor forever home. programme.desc: Thirteen of Britain's brightest and most ambitious chefs compete against one another for a jaw-dropping prize - their own restaurant in one of Britain's most historic hotels. Set within top central London hotel The Langham, the competition is judged the venue's head chef Michel Roux Jr, alongside pastry supremo and hospitality consultant Ravneet Gill and leading global restaurateur Mike Reid. The contenders are tasked to take on a range of epic challenges designed to test the skills they need to survive in the elite world of five-star dining

programme.title: Davina McCall's Pill Revolution
programme.desc: In recent years use of the contraceptive pill has reduced, while natural family planning methods have grown in popularity. On social media women are speaking out about side-effects they've put up with as a consequence of putting synthetic hormones into their bodies. Concerned about the choices that are available to her daughters and their friends, Davina investigates the myths and misconceptions that surround contraception and reveals the results of a Channel 4 survey that asked over 4,000 women and people assigned female at birth about the effects of contraception on their mental and physical health

programme.title: Open House: The Great Sex Experiment
programme.desc: Jess and Ben reveal a love of nudism and a desire to make the transition from the naturist scene to a non-monogamous lifestyle. However, Jess's hatred of social situations must first be conquered. Elsewhere, Kirsty and Tom have the opportunity to take a giant leap in opening their relationship by having bisexual experiences with the retreat's residents and consider attending a huge orgy

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: A romp through the Naked Attraction archive to catch up with dates that led to full-on romances - as well as some that turned out to be a disaster. They include Wolverhampton DJ Darryl from series one, who found his partner in Maria, and Scottish bombshell Amira from series five, who gives the lowdown on what really happened between her and Ste after their night of passion

programme.title: Untold: My Big Boobs
programme.desc: Podcaster and body confidence champion Jackie Adedeji meets a number of women with larger breasts. Some tell her about the pain that the weight of their bust brings, the difficulty they have exercising and the horrors of being overly sexualised when they were schoolgirls. Others, however, celebrate their bigger boobs. Jackie follows one woman's private surgery after being turned down by the NHS and meets another who successfully crowdfunded her P-cup breast reduction

programme.title: 60 Days on the Estates
programme.desc: Ed Stafford moves into a tower block not far from Birmingham's city centre, which has seen a worrying increase in youth violence in the wake of extensive cuts to youth services. Unemployment levels in the city are some of the highest in the country, and with the cost-of-living crisis biting hard, Ed also meets a former working mum-of-three who is currently claiming benefits and having to resort to food banks to feed her family

programme.title: Kids

programme.desc: Tom and Lori from London decide to leave the city and build a home at Graven Hill in Oxfordshire to give them a taste of the countryside and allow them to embark on an architectural adventure. They plan to build as much as they can themselves while leaving the groundworks and frame to the professionals but before they can begin they discover the groundworks are out of alignment with the frame

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Starkville, Mississippi, to try to rescue the failing Hotel Chester. Despite having more than 40 years' experience in the business, owner David Mollendor is at a loss as to how to make his dream of owning his own hotel work, while his wife Sukie is struggling as its chef, tackling the role without any formal catering experience. Gordon discovers a family tragedy that explains why this couple have become trapped in their business and wrestling with debt

programme.desc: The comedian heads into the heart of the country - Lancashire and Morecambe Bay, with its contrasting landscapes, quirky traditions, historic landmarks and community spirit. programme.title: World's Most Scenic Railway Journeys
programme.desc: A journey from the Mexican border at San Diego, following the Californian coast north to the city of San Luis Obispo, aboard the aptly named Pacific Surfliner. Pulled by a gleaming Siemens Charger locomotive, the rake of five double-deck coaches takes viewers on a 350-mile trip. Narrated by Bill Nighy

programme.title: Sinatra: King of the Crooners
programme.desc: The life of singer and actor Frank Sinatra, from his difficult birth and near death in Hoboken in 1915, through his rise to become one of the world's biggest entertainers. Using his music and with testimony from many of Frank's close friends, the programme charts his career highs and lows, as well as his numerous affairs with some of the world's most successful and beautiful women. The documentary also investigates Sinatra's links with organised crime, and aims to answer once and for all the allegation that his success was due to the Mob

programme.title: 70s Greatest Heart-Throbs

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A patient comes into the surgery needing a steroid injection for her chronic knee pain, and a young girl and her mother discuss depression and suicidal thoughts with Dr Ashraf. programme.title: Britain's Great Cathedrals with Tony Robinson
programme.desc: Liverpool cathedral is the Church of England's newest cathedral, and the largest in Britain. It was designed in the Gothic style by Giles Gilbert Scott, who also designed the red telephone box. It took 74 years to build and was paid for by money donated from the people of Liverpool. National tragedies such as the sinking of the Titanic - many of whose crew came from Liverpool - and the Hillsborough football disaster are remembered within its walls. It is also where Paul McCartney composed and performed his first classical piece of music, the Liverpool Oratorio

programme.title: Shenandoah (1965)
programme.desc: A Virginian farmer is left to raise seven children after his wife dies. He tries to keep his family out of the American Civil War, but when Union troops abduct his son, and his son-in-law enlists with the Confederates, he is unable to maintain his neutral stance and is dragged into the conflict. Western, starring James Stewart, Doug McClure, Rosemary Forsyth, Katharine Ross and Patrick Wayne

programme.title: Sink the Bismarck! (1960)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama, charting the mission to track down and eliminate the pride of the German fleet, a fearsome battleship devastating British vessels in the North Atlantic, orchestrated by a British naval officer recovering from his wife's death in an air raid. Starring Kenneth More, Dana Wynter, Laurence Naismith and Karel Stepanek

programme.title: Cat Ballou (1965)
programme.desc: A schoolteacher returns to her home town to find a ruthless railroad developer is trying to snatch her family's land. When her father is murdered by a hitman for refusing to sell his ranch, she resolves to defend the property, enlisting the aid of two small-time crooks and a drunken gunslinger with an equally inebriated horse. Musical comedy Western, starring Jane Fonda and Lee Marvin, with music by Nat King Cole and Stubby Kaye

programme.title: The Tin Star (1957)
programme.desc: A world-weary bounty hunter, formerly a sheriff, arrives in a small town where a newly-appointed lawman is struggling to keep the peace. When he learns of the mercenary's past, the inexperienced lawman seeks his help in learning the tricks of the trade so he can bring an outlaw gang to justice. Anthony Mann's Western, starring Henry Fonda, Anthony Perkins, Lee Van Cleef, Betsy Palmer and Michel Ray

programme.title: Eye in the Sky (2015)
programme.desc: Colonel Katherine Powell's mission to wipe out a terrorist cell in Kenya is complicated when a girl enters the blast radius of the intended drone strike. Powell has to decide between sacrificing the girl's life or letting the terrorists flee to carry out more atrocities. Thriller, starring Helen Mirren, Alan Rickman and Aaron Paul

programme.title: White House Down (2013)
programme.desc: A policeman is turned down for his dream job as a secret service bodyguard to the president. While taking his daughter on a tour of the White House, he gets the chance to prove himself when terrorists seize control of the building, putting the head of state's life in his hands. Action thriller, with Channing Tatum, Jamie Foxx, Maggie Gyllenhaal and James Woods

programme.title: Monster (2003)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama exploring the story of serial killer Aileen Wuornos, examining the circumstances that initially drove her to murder and the motivation for her subsequent crimes, as well as looking at her troubled childhood and intense relationship with another woman. Starring an Oscar-winning Charlize Theron alongside Christina Ricci, Bruce Dern and Scott Wilson

A gay man living with AIDS returns to his North Texan home to spend Christmas with his religious, conservative family, headed by his ex-military father, to whom he remains closeted. Drama, starring Cory Michael Smith and Michael Chiklis

programme.title: An Affair to Remember (1957)
programme.desc: Love blossoms on the high seas for a playboy bachelor and a former nightclub singer during a transatlantic cruise. When the liner comes into dock at New York, they agree to wait for six months and then meet again at the Empire State Building, hoping to prove to each other their relationship is more than a shipboard affair. Romantic drama, with Cary Grant, Deborah Kerr, Cathleen Nesbitt, Richard Denning and Neva Patterson

programme.title: Wake of the Red Witch (1948)
programme.desc: A ship owner and his embittered captain engage in a battle of wills as they fight for the love of the same woman and embark on a quest for a treasure chest of pearls hidden in the den of an octopus in the South Seas. Romantic seafaring adventure, starring John Wayne, Luther Adler, Gig Young, Gail Russell and Adele Mara

programme.title: The Caine Mutiny (1954)
programme.desc: US Navy officers rebel against their ship's erratic captain during a violent storm at sea, only to face a court martial back on dry land. However, the crew's actions seem to have been justified when evidence questioning the mental stability of their superior is produced. Second World War drama based on Herman Wouk's novel, starring Humphrey Bogart, Jose Ferrer, Fred MacMurray and Van Johnson

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen (2009)
programme.desc: The war between the shape-shifting robots erupts once again, as the first of the evil Decepticons leads an attack on Earth to locate an ancient planet-destroying machine. Hapless teenager Sam Witwicky is caught in the middle of the ensuing conflict as he holds the key to discovering the location of the device. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Shia LaBeouf and Megan Fox

programme.title: The Italian Job (2003)
programme.desc: A crook double-crosses his partners in crime, a betrayal that leaves their friend and mentor dead. One year later, they regroup and come up with a daring plan to exact revenge on the traitor and reclaim their ill-gotten gains. Crime thriller inspired by the 1969 movie, starring Mark Wahlberg, Charlize Theron, Edward Norton, Seth Green and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: Second Spring (2018)
programme.desc: After a woman receives a devastating diagnosis, she searches for a way of feeling alive in the face of her own mortality. Director Andy Kelleher's drama, starring Cathy Naden, Indra Ové and Jerry Killick

programme.title: 120 BPM (2017)
programme.desc: Members of an advocacy group demand action by the government and pharmaceutical companies to combat the AIDS epidemic in the early 1990s. Drama, starring Nahuel Perez Biscayart and Arnaud Valois. In French

programme.title: Father Brown (1954)
programme.desc: When works of art start disappearing, stolen by a master thief, Father Brown attempts to catch the culprit and save his soul. Comedy drama, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood and Peter Finch

programme.title: Pimpernel Smith (1941)
programme.desc: An unassuming English professor working on an archaeological dig in Germany leads a double life helping enemies of the Nazi regime escape the country. Second World War adventure based on The Scarlet Pimpernel, directed by and starring Leslie Howard, with Francis L Sullivan, Mary Morris, Hugh McDermott, Raymond Huntley and Manning Whiley

programme.title: At Gunpoint (1955)
programme.desc: A peaceable shopkeeper becomes a local hero when he accidentally kills the leader of a gang of bank robbers. However, when the dead bandit's partners in crime come looking for retribution, he finds the friends and neighbours who praised his bravery are now about to abandon him. Western, starring Fred MacMurray, Dorothy Malone and Walter Brennan

programme.title: The Swimmer (1968)
programme.desc: A world-weary man embarks on a unique odyssey of self-discovery, attempting to reach home by swimming in the neighbourhood pools along the way. Director Frank Perry's cult drama, starring Burt Lancaster, Kim Hunter and Janice Rule

programme.title: Home Alone (1990)
programme.desc: A boy has to fend for himself when he is accidentally left behind after his family jets off to Paris for Christmas. The youngster initially enjoys his freedom, but is soon forced to resort to ingenious booby traps to defend the family home from two dim-witted burglars. Comedy, starring Macaulay Culkin, Joe Pesci, Daniel Stern, John Heard, Catherine O'Hara and John Candy

programme.title: Mile 22 (2018)
programme.desc: A team of American intelligence officers, part of a top-secret tactical command unit, attempt to smuggle a police officer with sensitive information out of Indonesia. Thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg and Lauren Cohan

programme.title: All Eyez on Me (2017)
programme.desc: In 1995, Tupac Shakur is in prison, awaiting appeal. His third album, Me Against the World, has just been released to critical acclaim, but he's not got the freedom to enjoy any of it. Flashbacks reveal snippets of the rapper's early life with his activist Black Panther parents, and his eventual release. However, his success ends up being cut short. Drama, starring Demetrius Shipp Jr, Lauren Cohan and Kat Graham

programme.title: The Jesus Rolls (2019)
programme.desc: Fresh out of jail, sexually depraved misfit Jesus Quintana embarks on a criminal adventure with his friend Petey. John Turturro wrote, directed and stars in this comedy remake of Bertrand Blier's Going Places, recreating his role from The Big Lebowski. Also starring Bobby Cannavale, Audrey Tautou and Jon Hamm

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Rayne calls in help from her followers and fellow influencers to make sure Juliet ticks off every item on her bucket list. Cindy worries that Zara may have a change of heart

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Warren has his eyes on someone, but his attempts at flirting are not reciprocated. Romeo plans a special night for Juliet, and Norma comes face to face with an old acquaintance

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay continues his travels across America saving failing restaurants from disaster. In the first of two visits to Mill Street Bistro in Norwalk, Ohio, the chef encounters Joe Nagy, who claims he has the best menu from New York to Los Angeles. However, his servers and diners tell a different story, and his resistance to change leads to some explosive confrontations

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the concluding part of his trip to the Mill Street Bistro in Norwalk, Ohio, Gordon's disagreement with proprietor Joe Nagy erupts into one of his most intense confrontations yet. Just when it looks like he has turned the corner and is ready to accept help, Joe slips back into his old ways, denying his own failings and picking petty fights. Can Gordon get this stubborn owner to finally accept his advice and secure the future of his restaurant?

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Sheldon struggles to come to terms with his newfound popularity after employing his knowledge of statistics to help the high school football team his father coaches. Ray Liotta guest stars. Narrated by Jim Parsons

programme.desc: The young genius challenges a Nasa scientist about the space programme, and when he is dissatisfied with the answer, he begins to work on a series of equations to prove his point. Ian Armitage stars

programme.desc: Stuart takes Penny out for a second date, during which she drunkenly reveals her true feelings. programme.desc: Plans for a relaxed evening at Jay's turn out to be anything but when Claire is mad with her dad over his lack of gratitude for her holding the fort at work and Mitchell is busy scheming after receiving a gift he doesn't like. programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys and Pritchetts head Down Under for a family holiday so Phil can fulfil his mother's wish that he should one day return to the country where he was conceived. Rhys Darby (Flight of the Conchords) guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The guys compete for a tenured professor position at the university, leading them to try to win over the committee in charge of appointing a new staff member, and arguing about who deserves the spot the most. However, the panel includes Mrs Davis from Human Resources, whom Sheldon has crossed paths with before. Guest starring Regina King

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy tries to help Sheldon get over his desire for closure when one of his favourite TV shows is cancelled on a cliffhanger ending. Raj discovers his new girlfriend Lucy has a blog in which she has written about him, and is upset when he learns she believes he has feminine qualities, causing him to worry about their relationship

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard, Raj and Howard go camping to watch the Leonid meteor shower, but the trip takes an unexpected turn thanks to some specially baked cookies. Meanwhile, Penny injures herself in the shower, and with the rest of the gang out of town, it's left to Sheldon to come to her aid

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.desc: Dick gets to work on the walled garden in the spring and buys a mini tractor for the job - but it may not fit through the gate. Angel designs another suite, with black walls and mosaic mirrors, and decorates the entire dining room with blossoms so a guest can make a special wedding proposal. The couple also consider the possibility of truffle farming

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary following the staff of Woodgreen animal charity, who are committed to matching their homeless dogs with prospective owners. An eight-stone Newfoundland makes a favourable first impression on the Coxon family, but staff are worried that his habit of showering everyone with a spray of slobber may take some of the gloss off. Nine-week-old French bulldog Kevin competes with a nervous terrier to win the hearts of loved-up couple Ryan and Katie, while a recently widowed grandmother seeks another 'beating heart' to help fill a home that is feeling very empty

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Natasha Cargill wants to build a home shaped like two enormous periscopes in rural Norfolk, but to obtain planning permission, she has to ensure not only that the materials are sustainable, but also agree to measure the transportation used to deliver them. If these strict criteria are not met, she won't be allowed to live there, and to add to the pressure, she has just £330,000 to spend on construction and six months to complete the project. Kevin McCloud follows her progress

programme.title: Tutankhamun: Secrets of the Tomb
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ella Al-Shamahi investigates the strange deaths connected to the tomb, and questions if something inside it have been toxic to those who entered. She heads to a dig in Saqqara, where archaeologists have unearthed a network of undisturbed tombs, thousands of years old. Can scientific tests on the ancient mummies help to finally solve the mystery of King Tut's Curse?

programme.title: Caught on Camera

programme.desc: Xintong is rushed to A&E after being flung from a go-kart at speed. Doctors are concerned that there may be damage to the 28 year old's spine and send her for urgent CT scans. programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Heir Hunters

programme.title: Grand Designs: Living in

programme.desc: Fly-on-the-wall documentary series. Police in Western Australia arrest three young men after a car chase through suburban Perth, and a drunk man tries to get into his car in New South Wales.

programme.desc: Chris Harris and Freddie Flintoff check out a new hot hatch from Honda and an old hot hatch from Peugeot. Paddy McGuinness takes on his toughest challenge to date: getting a team of young amateur racers up to professional motorsport standard, in just two months

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: Yianni's latest client is transforming her life and ticking goals off on her bucket list. First was a fitness regime, second a full back tattoo and now comes the third task - she wants to turn her dull, green Range Rover into a sparkling red sensation that matches the bikini she wears when doing bodybuilding competitions

programme.title: Yianni: Supercar Customiser
programme.desc: This episode focuses on two cars and two very different social media stars, each with over a million subscribers. The first is a high-performance Mercedes E class coupe, which gets a unique red camouflage wrap. The other is a supercar with vandalised vinyl which needs stripping. Yianni wrapped Deji's Lamborghini Huracan a few months back, and the car has had paint splattered all over the bonnet. Will the wrap have saved the paintwork beneath, or will the 'haters' win?

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Bob Mortimer has harboured a childhood dream to catch a salmon, so together with friend Paul Whitehouse, he sets off for the River Tay in Scotland full of hope and excitement. A ghillie guides them up the intimidating river in a boat and they fish using various methods to catch the elusive fish. They stay in the heart of the Highlands, where Bob cooks Paul a traditional Scottish breakfast and enjoy a swift round of golf before resuming their fishing. The duo also reflect on luck and fate and the part it has played in their lives and later assess whether the trip has lived up to their expectations

programme.title: Mortimer & Whitehouse: Gone Fishing
programme.desc: Sitting side by side on the banks of the Upper Tamar Lakes, Paul Whitehouse and Bob Mortimer fish for the predatory perch. Bob notices that Paul has far more superior seating, which causes momentary tension between the pair. The tables are turned when Bob reveals this week's accommodation - leaving Paul almost speechless. The following day the duo brave the open sea and have a very surprising catch. They celebrate in the only way possible in the south-west of England - it's not particularly heart-healthy but it proves to be very tasty

programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches the capital on his rail journey from Warwick to Rye in East Sussex. In Ealing, he is transformed for the silver screen by expert hair and make-up, before travelling to Fulham, where he heads underground to explore London's new super sewer. Then, Michael visits the London School of Economics and Political Science in central London, before finally arriving in Kensington

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo journeys from Piccadilly Circus to Gravesend, visiting an exotic West End store that was popular among Victorian women and hearing how a Russian ballet company took London by storm in 1909. He also discovers the origins of netball and gymslips at North Kent College and meets the pilots of the Port of London Authority, founded in the early 20th century

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: The steeplejack shares his appreciation for the skills of the men who built Britain's great castles, palaces and country houses. He draws on his experiences as an apprentice joiner to offer demonstrations of building techniques, including the humorous falling-down arch

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: An insight into the steeplejack's appreciation for the craftsmanship and perfectionism of the past and for the work of those people who still carry on the traditions today

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his trusty 1913 Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo travels east through the Balkans along the most exotic section of the route taken by the Orient Express. His journey begins in Sofia, capital of Bulgaria, and includes stops in the ancient city of Plovdiv, the region of Rumelia, and former capital of the Ottoman Empire Edirne. Arriving in Istanbul, Michael takes a trip on the Bosphorus - a much-coveted stretch of water - finds out about Turkish delight and travels along the Marmaray metro line, which connects European and Asian Istanbul via a tunnel beneath the Bosphorus

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo enjoys a ukulele lesson in Haddington, East Lothian, birthplace of the Victorian self-improvement guru Samuel Smiles. In Musselburgh, he gets a taste of life as a fishwife, before exploring Edinburgh where a popular 19th-century mode of transport is making a comeback. Michael also visits the Royal College of Surgeons, where he discovers the macabre history of body snatchers and murderers and heads onwards to the University of Edinburgh Medical School, to learn how students use sophisticated technology to study anatomy

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Blackpool to Manchester, along the way unveiling a monument to 87 railwaymen of the London and North Western Railway who died in the Great War

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War II
programme.desc: How Field Marshall Erich von Manstein's escape from the Red Army influenced Nato's defence plans

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads from Warwick to Rye in East Sussex. In the orchards of East Malling, Kent, Michael discovers how the Edwardians' serious attitude towards cultivation bears fruit even now. In Folkestone, he hears how the town coped with an influx of more than 100,000 refugees fleeing the German invasion in 1914. In the High Weald, Michael heads for Tenterden Town and the light railway that opened in 1900. His final stop is the medieval Cinque Port of Rye, where he tours the home and garden of author Henry James

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of the 1930s as he sets out on another adventure. Beginning just outside Newcastle in Jarrow, Michael uncovers the desperation that led 200 men to march 300 miles to Westminster in order to petition the government for work. The first leg of his journey ends Spennymoor, Co Durham, where he meets the son of a miner who became one of the most famous 20th-century artists of the region

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: A look at the steeplejack's admiration for ordinary workers. From the labourers and stonemasons who built great medieval castles, to 20th-century coal miners and mill workers, Fred recognises that without hard graft nothing would have been possible

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Railway Collection
programme.desc: Steeplejack and amateur historian Fred Dibnah shares his passion for the railways by visiting workshops, museums and preservation lines devoted to their past. In the first episode, he looks at the early pioneers of the rail system

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Vienna, Michael Portillo encounters a pre-Cold War spy and learns about the concert that caused a riot in 1913. He then travels the Habsburg imperial line across the Semmering Pass, a line blasted through the Alps. In Graz, the former politician ventures underground at the Lurgrotte Caves to find out about a famous rescue operation of the past, then in Slovenia discovers how an earthquake in Ljubljana prompted its citizens to assert their national identity in architecture and art. Arriving in the Italian port of Trieste, Michael savours the imported coffee that fuelled a cafe culture

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo's journey from the Irish Sea to the North Sea continues by tram from Manchester. At the imposing town hall of the world's first industrial city, he comes face to face with the Victorian scientist who invented modern atomic theory. The latest stage ends at Silkstone Common, where he tracks down the forge where a Victorian metallurgist created wrought iron axles strong enough for railway rolling stock

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael starts his journey in Chapeltown, Sheffield, following what was once known as the North Country Continental service, and finishing in the engineering centre of Doncaster

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave heads to West Yorkshire to collect a rare 1926 Dodge bus. Derek gets his hands on a rare Vauxhall Victor VX 90 police car that is expected to sell for more than a few coppers

programme.title: Inside the Factory

Cherry Healey travels to South Africa to help with the macadamia harvest, where a quarter of the world's supply of these nuts are farmed. Historian Ruth Goodman climbs a mountain in the Lake District to investigate the history of one of the oldest forms of snack bar - the Kendal Mint Cake

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in Northumbria en route to the Highlands, heading to Kielder Forest to discover what lay behind a national initiative to plant one of the largest manmade woodlands in Europe. Crossing the border to Scotland, Michael arrives in the weaving town of Hawick to visit Lovat Mill, where, in the 1930s, tweed was big business, and also goes to the movies, sitting in the front stalls at the Dominion cinema in Morningside

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Following the route of the old Caledonian Railway Company, Michael Portillo discovers the 'Riviera of the Highlands'. With a daily direct train service to Kings Cross, Gleneagles remains a top destination and is also headquarters for the British School of Falconry. Berry Town, aka Blairgowrie, is Michael's next stop. At the home of the Scottish raspberry industry, which once sent fruit to London daily on board a raspberry special service from Cooper Angus station, Michael learns how to pick this most delicate of berries. The last stop on this leg is the city of Dundee, where he visits publisher DC Thomson

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Railway Collection
programme.desc: Steeplejack and amateur historian Fred Dibnah examines the work of the Stephenson family, and how it influenced the railways

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Railway Collection
programme.desc: The steeplejack investigates how railways changed Britain and follows the growth in popularity of the locomotive. Plus, a visit to a rope haulage railway in Derbyshire

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo experiences first-hand Italy's 'need for speed' in a state-of-the-art Maserati sports car, and discovers how the leaning tower of Pisa was rescued from near collapse. In Carrara, he finds out how the marble used by Michelangelo is still being quarried and is invited to chip away at a contemporary sculpture. Moving on to Bologna, the former politician embarks on a doomed search for spaghetti bolognese before being taught how to prepare a tagliatelle al ragu. Finally, he lets the wind rush through his hair on a high-speed boat trip across Lake Garda

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Gainsborough to Ely, along the way learning about a Victorian machine that changed shopping for ever and the poet Alfred Tennyson

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the final leg of his journey following the route of the North Country Continental service. Along the way he meets volunteers on the Mid-Suffolk Light railway and is permitted to drive 'The Middy'. In Leiston, Michael uncovers the world's first purpose-built assembly line, while in Ipswich the work of a young Victorian engineering prodigy impresses the ex-politician. At his destination of Harwich the presenter discovers how the port became a gateway to the continent, only to be superseded by a new deep-water port further inland

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: This week at the Mathewsons', there's a 1982 Audi Quattro and a Sunbeam Alpine. Plus, Derek takes delivery of a beautiful green Renault van, previously used as a bread van in Paris

Crossing the border to Scotland, Michael arrives in the weaving town of Hawick to visit Lovat Mill, where, in the 1930s, tweed was big business, and also goes to the movies, sitting in the front stalls at the Dominion cinema in Morningside

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Following the route of the old Caledonian Railway Company, Michael Portillo discovers the 'Riviera of the Highlands'. With a daily direct train service to Kings Cross, Gleneagles remains a top destination and is also headquarters for the British School of Falconry. Berry Town, aka Blairgowrie, is Michael's next stop. At the home of the Scottish raspberry industry, which once sent fruit to London daily on board a raspberry special service from Cooper Angus station, Michael learns how to pick this most delicate of berries. The last stop on this leg is the city of Dundee, where he visits publisher DC Thomson

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the biggest cider factory in the world, which produces more than 350 million litres each year. Cherry Healey explores how the factory is creating new orchards of a sweet apple variety called Scrumptious. And historian Ruth Goodman traces a Victorian apple breeding boom with Dr Annie Gray, recreating one of Queen Victoria's favourite baked apple desserts

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads to Scotland in the mother of all rainstorms to pick up a Jaguar E-type and a rare MGC convertible. Plus, Dave extracts a rare Austin Gipsey from a lock up

programme.title: The Yorkshire Steam Railway: All Aboard
programme.desc: General manager Chris calls a crisis meeting, believing the only chance the railway has of making it through the busy summer season is if an overhaul of Repton - a 1934 Schools-class engine - is completed. This engine has been undergoing restoration for the past five years, but now it is going to be all-hands-on-deck to try and get it back on the rails quickly. Meanwhile, Kieran discovers that a portion of track at one station is subsiding and cannot carry a load. The only option seems to be to shorten the Pullman dining train

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels across New York state, discovering how General Electric also leads the way in rail technology and examining the story behind George Eastman's Kodak company.
