programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole head to Norfolk, where Simon converts a trough into a bioethanol patio heater and Henry uncovers a vintage stationary engine

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Andy Daykin hosts the first dinner party in Edinburgh, opting for a Scottish-themed night complete with haggis, bagpipes and whisky. His guests are self-described cougar Liz Grant, perfectionist Irena Magdolowic, political researcher Toni Giugliano, and rock chick Michelle Lindsay

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Irena Magdolowic hosts the second round of the culinary contest in Edinburgh, and believes her experience as a catering manager will provide her with the necessary skills to claim the £1,000 prize. However, having been bored by chatter the previous night, she bans political conversation at the dinner table, and instead decides to provide her guests with a spot of traditional dance from her native Poland

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Liz Grant plays host to the third dinner party in Edinburgh. Having flirted with 28-year-old Andy for the last two nights, Liz is determined to make her move, but her food fails to impress, with one of her starters being compared to toothpaste

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: PA and rock chick Michelle Lindsay hosts the penultimate dinner party in Edinburgh and is confident her bizarre array of dishes will impress her guests. However, the starter proves confusing for Andy, while Toni and Irene criticise her main course, leaving the explosive entertainment and a liquor-laced pudding to salvage the evening

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Food enthusiast Toni Giugliano hosts the final dinner party in Edinburgh, and hopes to impress with a menu featuring green cocktails and haggis pasta. His guests plan on being critical of the food after growing tired of his constant complaining during the week's previous meals, and Liz tries her best to win the affections of Andy Daykin before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Married couple Mo and Anthony seek a holiday apartment with a sea view in Torremolinos on Spain's Costa del Sol. Laura Hamilton is tasked with showing them the best of what their £130,000 budget can get them. However, whether any of the five properties the property expert has up her sleeve will result in an offer remains to be seen

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Fred and Susan live and work on a farm in Norfolk and are looking for somewhere they can escape to during the quieter winter months. programme.title: Location, Location, Location

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Seventy-year-old Jenny is brought in with a suspected stroke, and doctors must confirm the diagnosis and decide whether she is still in time to receive life-changing treatment. Doctors assess whether the 29-year-old's pain is due to his kidney stones or something more serious. Ronnie is accompanied by his girlfriend Anneline, who reflects on the similarities between Ronnie and her late father

programme.title: The Last Stand (2013)

programme.title: Davina McCall's Pill Revolution
programme.desc: In recent years use of the contraceptive pill has reduced, while natural family planning methods have grown in popularity. On social media women are speaking out about side-effects they've put up with as a consequence of putting synthetic hormones into their bodies. Concerned about the choices that are available to her daughters and their friends, Davina investigates the myths and misconceptions that surround contraception and reveals the results of a Channel 4 survey that asked over 4,000 women and people assigned female at birth about the effects of contraception on their mental and physical health

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests check in to the Preston Hotel in Yeovil, owned by father and son Bis and Deep Oozageer. Ann and Rebecca find their room more cheap than cheerful, although an afternoon tasting the produce at a cider brandy distillery proves a massive hit

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third dinner-party challenge from Doncaster is hosted by trading standards manager Tracey Hewer. She hopes to win her guests over with a barrage of cupcakes, but the diners soon spot that her efforts have focused more on presentation than the taste of the food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Lecturer Signe Jase hosts the penultimate dinner party in Doncaster, preparing an adventurous menu of Latvian delicacies including herring salad and salted salmon. However, fussy eater Tracey refuses to try much of the food, which leaves Martyn unimpressed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil catch up with Steph and Mark who, in 2011, asked for their help to find a property they could live together and eventually have children in. programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series is centred around the roads of Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. There is also footage of drivers falling asleep at the wheel, overloaded vehicles and suspects caught with illegal substances - plus a host of excuses as the people pulled over try to persuade officers they have not done anything wrong

programme.desc: Documentary following the work of New Zealand police officers as they try to keep motorists safe on some of the country's most dangerous roads

programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: The guardian of the temple has passed on and a new Golden Dragon must be Chosen from a brother and sister - Twins born in the Year of the Dragon. Only one will be chosen. Their sibling bond tested.

programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency

programme.title: Department S
programme.desc: A double agent fakes his own death in a bid to escape reprisals for his betrayal - but both sides are determined to find him

programme.title: Planet Without Apes
programme.desc: Reporter Michel Abdollahi goes on a worldwide search to uncover illegal trade of great apes

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The pilgrims hatch a cunning plan to liberate the land of Codslow, ruled over by three evil immortals who depend on pearls, paper and wine to fuel their magical powers. Cult adventure, starring Masoaki Sakai

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The Moonbase is attacked by strong electric waves from a mysterious nearby planet, so the Alphans resolve to convince its residents they pose no threat. Sci-fi drama, starring Martin Landau, Barbara Bain and Nick Tate

programme.title: Lady Godiva Rides Again (1951)
programme.desc: A humble beauty contest winner finds herself launched on the road to stardom, but soon discovers a side to showbusiness she had no idea existed. Comedy, with Diana Dors, Dennis Price, George Cole and Joan Collins in her big-screen debut

programme.title: The Courtneys of Curzon Street (1947)
programme.desc: An aristocrat scandalously marries his mother's maid, and their family endures a series of crises over the next four generations. Period drama, with Anna Neagle and Michael Wilding

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: A journey through some of the most spectacular and unique Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: Italian cuisine, including a roast onion and rocket salad and calamari

programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay.

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: The Driver (1978)
programme.desc: A hard-bitten detective embroiled in a long-running investigation of a skilled criminal tries to outsmart the crook. Frustrated by his knack of fleeing the crime scene unscathed, the cop sets up a fake robbery in a bid to catch his man. Thriller, starring Ryan O'Neal, Bruce Dern, Isabelle Adjani, Ronee Blakley and Matt Clark

programme.title: The Maids (1975)
programme.desc: Two maids hate their employer, so whenever they are alone in the house, they indulge in a sexual roleplay fantasy in which they take turns dressing up as her, so the other can pretend to murder her. Drama based on Jean Genet's stage play, starring Glenda Jackson and Susannah York

programme.title: Mysterious Creatures (2006)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, starring Timothy Spall and Brenda Blethyn as the parents of a woman with mental health difficulties. When their daughter's hostile behaviour and the authorities' lack of support become too much to handle, the couple decide to commit suicide together, writing a letter to a local newspaper to explain the reasons behind their actions. The cast also includes Rebekah Staton and Judy Flynn

programme.title: Black Hairapy
programme.desc: Short documentary exploring the relationship between Afro hair and identity within the UK Afro-Caribbean community

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express

programme.title: Department S
programme.desc: A man is killed aboard what appears to be an fully functioning aircraft, but turns out to be an elaborate stage set build solely to provide a venue for the murder

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert takes a trip down the Wye, beginning in the Cambrian Mountains. He observes the mating behaviour of the sea lamprey and spots the varied birdlife along the river, including a colony of sand martins tending their young and all three species of British wagtail. He also meets Richard Davies, who has boosted water vole numbers in the area, and learns about Environment Agency scientist John Taylor's efforts to save the freshwater pearl mussel

programme.title: Wild Britain with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The survival expert is on the west coast of Scotland to explore one of the world's rarest habitats - temperate rainforest. He discovers the skittish sika deer and meets a lichenologist who shows him a wealth of species that thrive in Argyll's wet, humid climate. Ray also observes the nest of two ospreys and finds out why the reintroduction of the European beaver is benefiting other wildlife

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes on Mary's last day at work before her maternity leave when an old friend commits suicide - and she reluctantly decides to call off the wedding. Meanwhile, William plans the funeral of a kindly churchwarden, and is shocked to discover the deceased belonged to a society of cross-dressers. Martin Clunes and Julie Graham star

programme.title: A Kiss Before Dying (1956)
programme.desc: A psychopathic college student is horrified to learn his girlfriend is pregnant, threatening his chances of being accepted into her well-to-do family. In a fit of fury, he murders her and makes it look as if she had committed suicide - only for her sister to show up, taking an uncomfortable degree of interest in the manner of her sibling's death. Thriller, with Robert Wagner, Joanne Woodward, Jeffrey Hunter and Mary Astor

programme.title: San Demetrio London
programme.desc: The story of a British merchant ship in an Atlantic convoy in 1940 that was left disabled and at the mercy of patrolling U-boats. The crew must keep afloat and out of harm's way

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Ainsley's Gourmet Express
programme.desc: Italian cuisine, including a roast onion and rocket salad and calamari

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Munroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton sets out to visit some of the many islands that lay off the coastline. Heading to Foula and Fair Isle - the most remote island communities in Britain - he makes a nerve-racking visit to 'Da Snekk o' da Smallie' - a pothole in the cliffs of Foula that leads through to the Atlantic shore on the island, and learns about the beautiful knitting patterns that have made Fair Isle famous around the word

programme.title: Grand Tours of the Scottish Islands
programme.desc: Paul Murton turns his attention to the country's landlocked islands. He travels to Loch Lomond to get a bird's-eye view of an iconic beauty spot, before gaining an insight into the lives of its residents

programme.title: Kate Humble: Off the Beaten Track
programme.desc: Kate Humble and her Welsh sheepdog Teg explore Wales' countryside

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: The lives of three artistic brothers, a drummer, a sculpture and a DJ

programme.title: South Riding
programme.desc: Robert's home comes under threat of repossession, forcing him to make major changes. He heads to Manchester, where he bumps into Sarah - and the pair proceed to enjoy a day away from the stresses of their lives in the South Riding. However, neither of them anticipates the serious consequences their meeting will have. Meanwhile, Joe struggles to overcome municipal corruption as he tries to make his housing scheme a reality, and Lydia discovers her academic gifts could offer an escape from her family's crippling poverty. Drama, starring Anna Maxwell Martin and David Morrissey

programme.title: An Englishman in New York
programme.desc: John Hurt reprises his role as Quentin Crisp in this sequel to The Naked Civil Servant, picking up his story where the 1975 drama about the eccentric Englishman left off. Crisp sets off on the journey of a lifetime to the Big Apple, where the Americans immediately embrace the openly gay writer and his waspish ways, and before long he is being wined and dined by celebrities in every corner of Manhattan. But, as is so often the case with Quentin, he cannot resist making outrageous comments, and an ill-considered quip about the growing Aids crisis sees him suddenly dropped from high society. Sex and the City's Cynthia Nixon co-stars as performance artist Penny Arcade, with Jonathan Tucker, Denis O'Hare and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: Spaced Out (1979)
programme.desc: Four friends stumble across a crashed spaceship, which is crewed by three female aliens and their robot sidekick. The extraterrestrials force the humans to help them repair their vessel, but get distracted by their first close encounter with men. Sci-fi comedy, starring Barry Stokes and Tony Maiden

programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Crystal Palace and Shoreditch. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.desc: Short visual tours narrated by Dewyne Lindsay, this time exploring and revealing New Cross, Eltham, and Catford

He agrees to repair a roof for them, but the mother superior has a bigger task in store for him. starring an Oscar-winning Sidney Poitier, with Francesca Jarvis, Lisa Mann and Isa Crino

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: As the couple excitedly prepare for their wedding, Molly plans a special surprise by having Mary's estranged father attend the ceremony - but soon regrets her actions when the alcoholic sea-dog turns up in a drunken stupor. But that's just the first in a series of hiccups, as Reuben bursts into the church claiming Mary had already married him in Las Vegas. The blushing bride escapes from the ceremony, but William is hot on her heels - little suspecting the biggest shock is yet to come. Comedy drama, starring Martin Clunes and Julie Graham
